Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good room layouts, terrible location”
Reviews.Author: deborah n
Reviews.Content: As a long-time HHonors member, I want to start out with the positives. The staff at this hotel --from the front desk to the parking guys to the housekeepers -- are tremendous. My room was also good -- a junior suite with a little balcony. Over the loading dock and with no sun at any time of day, but since I booked a smoking room I can't complain. Acually greatful I was able to book a room that permitted smoking close to my meetings in Miami Beach. But the property is very very tired. The rooms are dark and dated, with beat up furniture and old carpeting. The exception is the beds -- they are fresh and comfortable, and even this smoking room does not smell. Even so, from the decor you'd think you were in an airport hotel. Not good. Needs updating badly. The worst thing is the locaton. There is nothing within walking distance of this hotel. The shopping area connected to the hotel is gruesome, dark, and a little creepy. There is a deli, but it's also not very appealing. You really need to get in a car to get anywhere you'd probably like to go, thereby incuring addtional parking fees (and parking here is pricey -- $29/night) and the inevitable Miami tolls. BTW, keep in mind that when they tell you the "hotel across the street" charges the same for parking, they're refering to the Hilton, part of the same chain. In short, I'm disapointed in the property but very satisfied with the service provided.

Reviews.Title: “GRAND HILTON VERY GOOD, ALMOST EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: denirokeane
Reviews.Content: Hilton Doubletree was very good. Clean, convenient, great staff, rooms are amazing, views on the harbor side are incredible. The hotel is almost perfect, just a couple of things that were at fault, but they are minor. There are no fridges in the rooms. I wanted a drink of water, none there, but I went and bought a bottle but couldn't chill it. The maids were coming around at 7:45am to clean the rooms, a little annoying. Lastly there is no breakfast facility, and so your only choice around are a couple of very very average cafes in the lobby retail area. That was the biggest disappointment. Apart from that it was perfect. I would definitely stay again and great value for money compared to what you get in South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise location”
Reviews.Author: Jaasond
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night before a cruise. We had a King Bay-view room and it was exactly as expected. Large room, comfy bed. Balcony overlooking the marina. We took the people mover to Bayside and had an awesome night out. There is a small "mall" attached with some shopping and a grocery store where we could stock up on items for the cruise (booze too!) Cab ride to the port in the morning was about $12. Would recommend this one to anyone needing a room before a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel mini suites”
Reviews.Author: cad307
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a mini suite at this Doubletree Grand Hotel Biscayne Bay in January 2012. The hotel is hard to find as the signs are not clear. Only has valise parking. Rooms are huge and luxurious. I really object to paying top rates for hotels which then charge extra for wifi and parking when cheaper hotels and Hampton Inns do not charge and also give you a free breakfast. I had to move rooms away from the loading dock ramp to the adjacent apartment building as the noise from delivery trucks never stopped. Once in the new room all was good.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Jerseyker
Reviews.Content: We booked a king bay view room with a balcony. We had phoned the front desk two or three times, prior to our arrival, to request an early check in as we had a conference to attend. As a silver level hilton honors member, this has never really been a problem. We were told that they were not fully booked the night before and an early check in would be possible. When we arrived, the girls at the front desk recognized us by name and immediately apologized stating we could not have a room early as promised. This really wrecked our plans and we had to roam around for hours. Unfortunately, the pool was closed so we could not hang there and the hotel itself is kind shabby. I ended up hanging out at the Hilton across the street and, if I had known better, would have stayed there as well. The hilton said they would have given me an early check in without such an ordeal as encountered at the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “So many much better hotels in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Grandexplorer
Reviews.Content: Poor service from reception to departure. Rooms are equipped with old furniture and noisy air conditioner with ripped carpet and holes in doors where a hook should have been there for towels. Housekeeping skipping room for service. Worse part is: if this is what a Diamond HHonors gets wonder what the general public gets?

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise location and close to Bayside shopping facility.”
Reviews.Author: Adriene H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently and one other time a few years ago. The staff are always very friendly and helpful. There are rooms available with oceanviews that are affordable for the downtown location. This is a great pre-cruise location and it close to the Bayside shopping facility. It is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: lorijeannj
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 bedroom/2 bath condo and it was just what we needed for two couples. Beer/wine downstairs in the shops ($$$$). MetroMover not far (1 block) which takes you to Bayside Market where you can grab a bite to eat and get some souvenirs if you wish. Doubletree exceeded my expectation for a 1 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lyllidar
Reviews.Content: A nice grand hotel but a bit disappointing in terms of location and its connections. Good for work trips since you're out of tourist attractions but away from the night scenes. An advantage it's its proximity to the Omni loop to reach downtown during day time. Large and comfortable rooms, small but relaxing swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty or room for 4-6”
Reviews.Author: Brad B
Reviews.Content: I had a couple of rooms at the Bayshore DTree and was quite impressed with the size of the accomodations. Even the bathroom & hallway was oversized in my standard room. The 2 double beds could have easily been replaced with Queens while leaving plenty of room to walk around them, and still not have encroached on the sitting area with a pull out couch. A nice contrast to a recent 2 room Residence where I couldn't walk through the room with the sleeper couch extended. The view over the bay was a nice plus as was the balcony. All in all this was quite a nice room where my 5 family members could have stayed comfortably for several days. Needed a fridge and microwave though. I never asked if any were available because we only were staying for one night. For a contrasting opinion my wife believes her purse turned up $50 lighter while we were gone...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: debbieinnc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the bay and within walking distance to Bayside Marketplace. The rooms are comfortable and large with nice amenities. Attached to the hotel is a concourse filled with restaurants and boutique shops. The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but not much else...”
Reviews.Author: Valencia_Lakes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the ING Miami Marathon. We could walk to the start line right next to the American Airlines Arena. You could also walk to the Opera House and it's a short cab ride to either the Miami Beaches or the cruise ships. Conventions too. Otherwise, go somewhere else (Miami Beach, Coconut Grove, anywhere...). The neighborhood is full of urban decay (chain link, empty lots, vacant buildings) and looks dated. The builiding is a bit dated and 85% is a condo building (seems every occupant has a dog they all walk on the pavement). When we arrived in our car we were promptly ignored while the doormen stood around doing nothing. No one offered to get our bags. No one held the door. It was a bit odd. The desk staff was professional, quick, and courteous (highilght?). The room faced north (6th floor) and was LOUD. We could hear the loading dock, the garbage, the delivery trucks, the traffic, water from other rooms. Maybe bayside rooms are quieter? We got stuck in the elevator (doors wouldn't open) but were promptly rescued. The room was nice (bed, sheets, furniture) but no fridge, cable worked off and on, no balcony or way to open windows. Did I mention the pool was closed as well? On the brightside was the small "mall" between the hotel and the next building. There was a small deli with a Starbuck's, a restaraunt, sports bar, and drugstore. If we run again next year I'll try somewhere else. The cookies at check-in were good but not $270 a night good....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: MsMimi31
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue! Booked this hotel online last minute for a quick trip to Miami with a girl friend for a 1 night event. Selected a double room - basically the internet special - since we planned to be out of the hotel for most of the evening and the room didn't have to be amazing, just comfortable. Shortly after I submitted the booking, I sent an email to the hotel to confirm (have had issues before so I always do) and let them know we were excited to be arriving the next day and promptly received a very nice response. Sweet! So I wrote back to say thank you very much - see you tomorrow. We arrived the next day, and as I checked-in, the clerk informed me that they had a note in their system to offer us an upgrade. Of course we accepted and thanked them kindly and proceeded to find our room. It wasn't until we walked in and found an absolutely gorgeous 2 bedroom penthouse suite overlooking the bay that we realized this was no ordinary upgrade. So I went back downstairs and asked the clerk if they were sure we were given the right room - and the response was that the manager simply appreciated hearing that some guests were excited to be staying with them... Then they gave me some ideas for places to eat and extra cookies. That was the best customer relations I'd ever experienced at a hotel. My friend and I enjoyed the trip far more than we'd expected to - So, Thanks, Doubletree by Hilton Grand Hotel Biscayne Bay!! Your hotel will always get my business!!

Reviews.Title: “It will ruin your vacation”
Reviews.Author: Franco53703
Reviews.Content: This hotel has several problems but none is more important than its horrendous floor plan. While the elevators are on one side of the hotel, close to the reception, some of the rooms are literally hundreds of yards away. We had to walk at least 10 minutes to access or leave ours. To add insult to injury, on our floor there were stairs midway down the never-ending hallway, which forced us to lift three heavy pieces to continue our trek. If you have to stay here, ask for a room close to the elevators! Or better still, stay at a competitor's property.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Wonderful Views”
Reviews.Author: kinch1
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel and the gorgeous view from our room. The location was perfect. The staff were fantastic and the rooms spacious, if somewhat dated. The only negative was the internet - it worked sporadically and I had to pay for each device - my iPad and my computer. One WiFi purchase did not cover everything in room so it got pricey. Would otherwise recommend very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: AwayweGoFamilyTravel
Reviews.Content: The staff is nice, but the room I stayed in was not up to DT standards. Nothing worth walking to, was close by. Given this awesome city, I would not stay here again. I think they stay booked up so they don't seem to need the business. I was a large corporate client, and a HH member, but they did not seem to give a crap. Pool was still being "renovated" INTERNET ACCESS is aweful. The HD tv was nice. Dining options are nill, the place in the "lobby" is crowded with limited selections, no areas to gather and meet with co-workers, the mall attached is really bad. the bay views are nice but that is about all this property has going for it... and they don't do much to affect that. The room service staff was very good, and the front desk staff was very nice, as was the house keeping staff. But over all the property is lacking in amenties and feel. This may be becuase it is tied into a residential high rise. There is a full service Mariott and Hilton close by, if you have to be in this area i would book there first.

Reviews.Title: “Just "OK" on Biscayne Bay”
Reviews.Author: penright8888
Reviews.Content: Before our cruise, we stayed at this hotel for one night. It is only 5 minutes away from cruise ship docks. With taxes we payed $237.00 with a reservation through Expedia. These are 4 star prices for a 3 star hotel. The rooms are nice but not special. The restaurant upstairs on the deck is a pub and is average. The restaurant downstairs in the mall is good for breakfast. I have stayed at Doubletree's all over North America, and this is the only one I haven't been really impressed with. The locatiion is the selling point, and you pay dearly for it.

Reviews.Title: “dont seem to care”
Reviews.Author: Evy W
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and get upgrades easily with hilton. We got, as we paid for, big room with free internet and breakfast. The pool was beeing renovated, so no pool. But we could go to the pool of another hotell right beside our hotell. Fair enough. But the internet doesnt work in the room, just in the hallway, and the staff didnt seem to care. We got no help with this, or even a "so sorry". And when it came to breakfast, we was not informed that they do not have such at the hotell, but they gave us a 6 dollar kupong we could use in the next door mall. That was LOW! Who wants to trade in a breakfast in a dining room for a kupong at a mall? And we didnt know this untill breakfast time. And what would 6 dollars give us? We had to drive to somewhere else and buy our own breakfast, that we already paid for in the hotellroom prize. Hilton and doubletree has always been a good place, but this one in Miami was poor!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality was awesome”
Reviews.Author: Sean M
Reviews.Content: Reached in the morning. One of my friend had our tickets in hotel. Greeted well at the welcome gate and was impressed by the hospitality. Bayside marketplace was an awesome to hang there. Pool was great. One thing I like so much about the hotel that they don't allow pets.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: Ayo S
Reviews.Content: Being a consultant that is on the road a lot, I have stayed in my fair share of hotels this year alone. That said, this was one of my favorites and here is why; We were concerned that we weren't staying on Miami beach but it turned out okay in the end. This hotel is across the bay from Miami beach. It sits right on Biscayne bay. We paid a little extra to get a room with views and it was well worth it. Waking up to sunrise on the bay is breathtaking. The service was incredibly helpful. They even helped me print something I needed to print. They gave me an extra breakfast coupon that I could redeem at one of the stores in the hotel where the food was not all that great but what can you do. They have a great pool and a giant clover shaped jacuzzi that can fit a ton of people. It is compartmentalized so it's not awkward to share with others. The hotel is right by a wonderful park just down the road ideal for jogs and scenic leisurely walks if that's your thing. Parking is 29 bucks a night but you can find street parking if you look.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful start to our cruise”
Reviews.Author: t42
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in #2944 which is a huge one bedroom condominium with a large balcony overlooking the Intracoastal. We had almost every facility you could ask for: 1 1/2 bathrooms, walk-in shower, washer & dryer, furnished balcony, large walk-in closet. Would have liked an in-room safe. Our internet was free, although a bit slow. We had lots of restaurant choices within the attached mall. Tony Chan's Waterclub had excellent sushi for my husband and Chinese food for me. We had discounted coupons for breakfast at the deli so we bought our coffees and pastries and enjoyed them on our balcony. The pool was large, empty and at a comfortable temperature. The free elevated tram is less than a block away and the cruise port not much farther. Yes the hall carpets are a bit tired but everything within the condo was in good condition and repair.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: jharris017
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in Dec. 2011 for two nights. The room we very clean, but had trouble with the inter-net, very, very slow!

Reviews.Title: “Great bookend to a cruise vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ron W
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel bookending our Caribbean cruise on the Norweigan Epic. On the night before our cruise, they booked us into a bay view room, but around 9 PM that night, a loud dance party broke out at the bar four floors below us. We called the front desk and they told us that they had no control over the establishment and the noise ordinace didn't go into effect until midnight. A few minutes later the desk called back and offered to move us to an upgraded room and sent a valet to help us. Problem solved. On the return trip, we checked in early and were welcomed back with a full upgrade to a condominium suite with a kitchen, and laundry so we were able to get a jump on the post vacation chores. The location wasn't great, as you needed a cab to reach the beach or downtown, but the amenities at the hotel were quite nice. Great health club at no cost. And a very good Asian/fusion/sushi bar in the promenade. All together a great experience. If you're cruising out of Miami, it's a great place to start out from or spend and extra day before returning home.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl713
Reviews.Content: We began our week trip at the hotel prior to our cruise. It wasn't too close to south beach but it wasn't too far. Cab ride was about $15 to $20 to get to south beach. The location was great. Thank you Priscilla (front office supervisor) for giving us a great room with a great view of the bay. We work in the industry for a 4 star property and appreciate the kindness we expect from Staff at the hotel. There were lots of stores at the hotel, which we were unaware of until we began to explore the hotel. The room was fairly a decent large size. I would recommend this hotel and stay here again. We may see each other very soon!

Reviews.Title: “More Residential than Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chris f
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a building approximately 40 stories high. The hotel lobby is on the same floor as the residence concierge. This hotel occupies floors 6,7,8,&9. It shares the pool and hot tub with the residential owners. It was a good facility for cruising the next day from the Port of Miami, but I would not recommend it for staying in Miami for more than one night. It was clean and on par with the Doubletree standard. I actually did laundry in the hotel that night. The machines were $3 each but the hotel provided free detergent if you called housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, okay location”
Reviews.Author: peejay10
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Doubletree on business and in a very comfortable junior suite. Price was just shy of $200 (pre-tax) for AAA rate. Great big TV and comfortable bed. Nice work desk and sofa for relaxing. AC a bit noisy, but it was not so warm that I could not just turn it off at night. Nice view of the water too. Walked about 1 mile to Bayside Market Place for shopping and dining. Area supposedly 'sketchy', but I did not feel unsafe walkiing. The steak restaurant (Los Gauchitos)within the hotel plaza had very good filet for only $25 and a custom made Sangria to boot. Nice stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: SNoon4056
Reviews.Content: If you can't stay on South Beach, go to the Doubletree Grand. This location is predominantly a condo building, and it has an adjacent (cheesy) retail area. And yes, it's next door to the Marriott. But once you get past all the location issues, the hotel is a fantastic value. First, the rooms are remodeled nicely. Second, the service is excellent. And third, the views of Biscayne Bay are breathtaking. This hotel is home to my most favorite suite in the county (and I stay in hotels 200+ nights a year) and the largest hot tub I've ever been in. The corner suite I request, Room 751, has a balcony on both sides (south and east) and overlooks the marina and two causeways to Miami Beach. The pictures tell the story below. I had a lovely king size bed with the wonderful Hilton sheets, a sitting area, a dining room table, AND a working area. The bathroom features marble floors, a separate glass shower, a bidet (who needs that?), and a jacuzzi tub. Awesome. The room service is excellent and timely. I think you should save a small fortune and stay at the Doubletree. Skip the Omni and and Marriott-- even avoid the snotty Miami Beach scene-- and try this favorite of mine! If the hotel wants improvement suggestions, I think the hallways are too dark.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: jas w
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel with great customer service, clean rooms, and good food. the meals and drinks were a bit pricey at the restaurant and bar but I would definitely stay there again. Great work staff. The valets, bell men, servers, and front desk clerks were terrific. Special thanks to Gina, Chris, and convention room servers!

Reviews.Title: “Please don't go”
Reviews.Author: Sammy31
Reviews.Content: Old hotel with friendly staff. We had 2 problems in our room. I'm a HHonors Diamond member. At the second problem, I informed that we were moving to a different hotel, they changed our room. Please don't go.

Reviews.Title: “A weak link in the DoubleTree chain”
Reviews.Author: Barry S
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in several DoubleTree hotels and they are generally okay -- but, this one... a bit of a joke. Stayed there just one night prior to a cruise and would never go back. We finally got a decent room but it took 3 tries as they kept trying to push smoking rooms on us - and they were argumentative. Dining options are poor. The hotel is just so-so. The only favorable aspect is how close it is to the cruise port.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for a cruise!”
Reviews.Author: brandywinelady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there recently, October 2011 for two nights before a cruise. Nice, typical Doubletree....warn cookies upon arrival, very friendly hotel staff. Very nice large suite with a view. Though the hotel shares a lobby with the Doubletree condos, it was not a problem. There were quiite a few little dogs with their owners, however being a dog lover, I enjoyed the area. There was a very nice shopping area attached with access to a marina. Miami beach and South Beach were a short cab ride away. I have stayed at the Marriott next door for business, so I would say that this is a mixed area of business travelers, vacationers, and residents.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: martess5
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel once in the past and it is very nice. We are leaving on a cruise for a honeymoon out of Miami in Nov and are staying at this location again. It is a special night for us so I attempted to contact the hotel to see if they could assist me with a few small requests. All I can say is that both the staff and management alike are first class. Within a few hours the manager had gotten back to me with a sincere and helpful attitude. With the assistance of the hotel manager the stay is going to be incredible. I did not even expect to get a response, let alone the helping hand that was offered to make the night better. I truly appreciate the quick response, the assistance, and the overall warm and friendly welcome for our upcoming stay. Its hard to find this type of customer service nowadays. Thank you. We will certainly be back every time we visit Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Just OK/good for Biz Travel”
Reviews.Author: TiffApple
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the DoubleTree on Biscayne Bay in September 2011. The hotel itself is beautiful - looks like it has just been redecorated. All common spaces and rooms are very tastefully decorated. The shower / toilet / bidet (yes, I said bidet) portion of the bathroom looks to be the vintage style, but not necessarily in a bad way. The people at the front desk were very helpful at check-in and check-out (they granted myself and a fellow traveler - both Hilton Gold - last-minute late checkouts because our meeting ran over). Pro's: Reasonably priced restaurants Reasonably priced mini-bar Decor is beautiful Comfortable room/bed Good-sized bathroom Gorgeous bay view There are a handful of reasons that I would mark this DT an 'good': No Wifi in Rooms. This is becoming more of a problem for anyone using a non-3G iPad (or other tablet, for that matter) that can't be plugged in. It is also terribly inconvenient while using the laptop as well. Along similar lines, my room didn't even have a cord to plug in, so I had to call to get one (though the IT person that came up was very prompt). Mini-Bar. Only stocked with one diet coke. They could have sold me 2 more if it had been stocked properly! Gym. The gym is the only part of the hotel (from my perspective) that has not been redone. The entrance is incredibly deceiving, as it has been redecorated. However, all of the equipment in the gym is old, old, old. The ellipticals struggled, stair-steppers were the same ones I used in the 90's and weight equipment is of a similar era. All in all, I had a good stay at the DoubleTree, I just wish they would fix the wifi and gym issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: eighthwonder
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel that is situated only a short cab ride away from all of the major beaches and downtown Miami. Everything was neat and clean when we stayed here, and the decor was modern and tasteful throughout the hotel. The room was large and attractive and the bay view that we had from our balcony was excellent (we were right on the corner of the building). If you looked closely you could tell that the room was a bit worn out (chips and stains here and there), however it wasn't terrible by any means. They also had a coffee station with Wolfgang Puck products, an ironing board and iron, a safe, and a flat screen tv in the room. The bed was very comfortable. Staff members that we met were all helpful and friendly, and we got great advice about local attractions from the concierge desk on many occasions. The front desk even gives you warm chocolate chip cookies when you check in. Since the hotel is attached to a shopping complex there were plenty of places to wander and shop, and there were at least four restaurants within the attached complex. We didn't use the pool, but it looked nice, however we did use the gym a few times and were pleased. They had a good assortment of weight and cardio machines and an aerobics room. This is a great place to stay in Miami for any reason, business or vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cocoabeachgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Apartment/condo building. I can't say enough about our gorgeous Apartment. We were with our Son and his wife and were so comfy. Beautiful Bay views, 2 bedrooms, 2 full baths, nice fully stocked kitchen, living room & den. In the same building you will find high end shopping, deli, groceries, restaurants as well as bars. Everything under one roof.

Reviews.Title: “Average, but gets the job done for pre/post cruise.”
Reviews.Author: IloveTX
Reviews.Content: I must be honest, and say that I was very worried after reading the reviews on this property. It was an average stay. Had 1 night pre- and one night post- cruise. Even with Gold Honors status, there was no room upgrade. We got breakfast in the cafe downstairs (to go) and had to wait in line behind uniformed staff members getting their own breakfast both days. The rooms could use a soft renovation (wallpaper, curtains, paint) but the rooms and linens were clean. Despite being in a quiet end of town, there was a ton of delivery truck/street noise outside our window both days. Pool area was spacious and virtually nobody there. Bring your own snacks and beverages and hang out! Quad hot tub is huge. Outside the hotel, you will not find much for restaurants in the immediate area. We went in August, so a 2 mile walk was way too hot. However, we found out (after we were exhausted, hot, and tired...) that there is a free elevated tram. The station is a few blocks away and you can take it down to the Brickell area where there are highly rated restaurants. Front desk staff totally dropped the ball on this suggestion when we asked about how to get around. The best idea they had was taxi and bus. DON'T TAKE THE BUS!!! Front desk also dropped the ball on booking our cruise shuttle. Then they didn't communicate that we needed a voucher or something to give the driver once we got the shuttle re-confirmed and paid for. They would be better off telling you to ask the concierge instead of only half-way handling guest inquiries. So it was not a horrible stay, but it was not a joy either. I would suggest you find a hotel that has a free airport & cruise port shuttle and a location closer to area highlights. It might be more expensive per night, but you will spend the money getting yourself around anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Dated but lovely”
Reviews.Author: SlightlyDusty
Reviews.Content: The hotel shares facilites with the Grand a condo/apartment type building. They had some minor maintenance problems (elevator to pool was out of commission, air in our room died, etc) but they took care of us and this is a gorgeous place. We loved our room and the view and if you are a jacuzzi lover this place had the best jacuzzis ever... four of them Wow! I think they missed out on several thousand dollars by not having cocktail service at the pool and spa but I can do that tfor them if they want and I am willing to move there arnd run drinks up to the pool area as long as I can have one once in a while. The breakfast coupons were kinda goofy one day we got 8 dollars each the next 7 dollars and the last day 6 dollars we really didnt care as the food was good at the deli and the restaurant so a couple of bucks one way or the other was "Non Importante!" The last day (29 August) we called the front desk three times around 1220 waiting to check out and never got an answer so it was a good thing there was no emergency. I ended up walking down stairs and getting our own bellman as the front desk obiviously had more important things going on. Anyway, thanks for the service on the other days and the beautiful junior suite we loved it and are thinking of coming back soon. You can get a shuttle from the air port and cabs to South Beach if you no not want to get a car. South Beach is alot like like Europe (Italy) except they speak Spanish. Dont be surprised if you visit a fast food restaurant and they dont speak English,. It is all part of the charm and the current future of America.

Reviews.Title: “just what we hoped”
Reviews.Author: brinny
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bed bayview condo and it was just what we hoped. Although we checked in very early and didnt get the condo allocated to us the one we had was very comfortable with everything we needed albeit not luxurious. We especially appreciated being able to check in early and found the reception staff and concierge to be friendly and helpful. The condo was very clean with a large balcony and great views over the tennis courts and bay .It was equipped with crockery, cutlery etc and a welcome pack of coffee/creamer /sugar plus a useful packet of detergent with more supplied by housekeeping when requested. Breakfast could only be taken with a voucher used at the nearby deli or at the adjoining restaurant for a set american breakfast ( bacon or sausage ,eggs any style , potatoes.toast ,tea or coffee with no substitutions allowed) and is definitely not a breakfast buffet despite what our reservation stated.The deli is very good for both hot and cold dishes. Housekeeping was efficient and prompt . The car valet system was quick and eficient and costs $15 per day when in a condo but more we think with the hotel. As others have stated we think one building has straightforward hotel rooms while the other is condos mainly with permanent residents all of whom were friendly toward us. There is free internet access with 3 computers although no working printer during our stay. There is a pool with sunbeds but the pool bar was not staffed during our stay. From our experience we would recommend the Doubletree Grand especially for people needing more than one room since the condo we had provided everything we wanted and everyone was very friendly and helpful towards us. As well as appreciating being able to check in early we also appreciated reception staff suppling a pass key so we were able to use the hotel pool etc for a couple of hours after we had checked out. All in all a good stay !!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Miami”
Reviews.Author: South81
Reviews.Content: I was quite suprised by this hotel. Its a great place to stay on biscayne bay in downtown miami and easy to get to everything you might one to do or see. The hotel itself is part of a condominium building and occupies only couple of floors. Positives: The lobby is beautiful, check in easy, staff very friendly and accomodating, great gym, clean and big rooms & bathroom, plasma TV with great channels, comfortable beds, reasonably good views even with city view rooms, fast wi-fi internet, 24hrs coin operated laundry, convenient shops on the premises (barber, mini-market, bar etc). The Le Faubourg Deli was absolutely great - you can get small items and great fresh food. No negatives but it wouldnt hurt to offer free wi-fi and update the balconies - they seem neglected in terms of repairs & cleaning. Tips:(1) From the airporty you can either get a taxi for $25 or take a Super Shuttle for half the price. (2) There is Omni Metromover station and a bus terminal literally 3 min from the hotel. The metromover is free and can get around downtown miami and other neighbourhoods. You can also get buses to miami beach cheaply.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for cruise go-ers!!”
Reviews.Author: Jesss349
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before our cruise . We left our car at hotel and the hotel shuttle took us to the port. Hotel gives you best warm cookies on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: Miamimami71
Reviews.Content: Once again--Downtown Miami shines as the best spot to get a nice hotel-at a decent price! I was very pleased with my stay here-I chose this hotel for my husband and my anniversary-and im glad i did. I booked this hotel less than a week in advance and still got a great rate-on a weekend-no less-AND because i joined the Hilton Honors club, upon check-in we received a comp upgrade to a Junior King Bayfront suite! (I had booked a reg. King balcony room). The view was gorgeous, my husband said the gym was amazing, the pool area was nice, i found the staff to be really, really amazing, esp. the housekeeping staff. Roberto went above and beyond to help me and i appreciate it, and he did it all with a genuine smile. Being a south FL. local, i know customer service can be a lil absent sometimes in Miami. Not at the Doubletree. Everyone said hello with a smile. We enjoyed the room and the balcony so much. Oh and the bed! The hiltons signature beds are sooo comfy! Thanks for helping us make it a great occasion!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and very accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: oceanlover1958
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very close to the Port of Miami. We used the Super Shuttle to get from Miami Airport to the Doubletree ($13.00 per person). It was perfect for our pre-cruise stay. Staff were very friendly; room was so comfy. We had a a double bed bay-view which we could see the cruise ships coming in to port! The bathroom is very spacious, lots of vanity space. Hotel room was very clean. The bed was 'to die for'. Even though the Doubletree was only 1 mile from the port, we used their shuttle service to get there (didn't want the hassle of hauling luggage 1 mile!); there was a small fee, but it was worth it. We did not use room service, but opted to go down to the small mall and grabbed a meal at the Le Faubourg Deli. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but won't go back”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a night before our cruise and two night after. The Hotel is shared with condos and some mall shops and resturants. Not much in walking distance unless your going to the convention center. The rooms were great and big. The pool is cozy and has a nice view of the bay. We took a red eye flight and check-in WAY early which new check-in was not until 3:00pm and the front desk ladies told us they would probably have a room early and will let us know when its availible. We were ok with this so we had breakfast and hung out in the lobby while we waited for our rooms. After other couples arrived and hung out waiting for a room as well in the lobby with us for a few hours the front desk told them of a floor they could go to that was more of a loung for them to wait in and left us sitting there. Within an hour they were down there getting there room while we once again sat there for another hour..... After the 2nd time asking if our room was ready and a new shift or girls came on our room keys were sitting there on the side of the counter the whole time!!!! We were literly sleeping in the lobby were they could see us we were so tired! I felt it was rude that they watched us the whole time and let other people in there rooms while they could see us still waiting. I will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: patience_is_key
Reviews.Content: Everyone from valet to engineering was very courteous and professional. Outstanding customer service throughout our entire stay. We had a condo suite which was very large in size, the room was clean as well as great bay and city views from the balcony. The location was convenient, approx. 10 min. drive to South Beach. The least part of our stay was the noisy toilet and washing machine that did not have cold water nor did the rinse cycle work. The best part of our stay was the warm cookies you receive at check-in and the comfort of the beds.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright”
Reviews.Author: Chi_sb2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, but it took them 31/2 hours to get our room ready. we were exhausted from the flight and the cab driver took advantage of us and looped around the city 2 so that our fare would be double the amount it should have been. I was pissed!!! The hotel has a mall connected to it which was very convenient, also several restaurants. Their customer service desk needs a bit more training on being nice but all in all the service and overall stay was alright.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you so much!!!”
Reviews.Author: JackieB00
Reviews.Content: It was my 50th birthday celebration with girlfriends from the US, Canada, Cayman Islands and Barbados and the staff at Double Tree Grand were all OUTSTANDING!!!! Kind, helpful throughout the weekend stay and when we had issues at check in, they were calm and professional. On departure, we gave the ladies at the Front desk, flowers and a gift basket as tokens of our appreciation and I will definetely stay there again. The rooms were clean and all on the same floor, hotel security was excellent and the concierge were all helpful and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Fancier than it sounds”
Reviews.Author: thequeencole
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy about thus hotel. Great location on biscayne bay. I was charged mini bar charges by mistake but they were adjusted. Parking fees are way to high and the breakfast was not too good but an overall nice stay. Almost convinced to try other doubletrees but I know they wont be as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jennystuart17
Reviews.Content: My sister and I plan a yearly trip, so we can catch up. This year we decided we wanted to visit a vibrant destination, where we could enjoy the beach as well as shopping; thinking about the perfect destination we decided to travel to Miami! We selected the Double Tree Grand Hotel Biscayne Bay because of its location. It is pretty close to South Beach, the Art Deco Historic District, Miami Beach and Brickel Avenue financial district. We really enjoyed our stay, the staff pampered us as if we were their only guests! The hotel is fashionably appointed; the room we stayed at had two double beds, coffee maker, cable t.v., hair dryer, radio, safe deposit box and of course a balcony. The fitness center is great and there is a jogging track as well. We do not play tennis but there are tennis courts for those who love this sport. There is a beautiful outdoor pool but we enjoyed the afternoon at the indoor whirpool. If you like pizza I had the best at Bleu Moon, they have a brick oven! We also enjoyed a very good Asian style dinner at Tony Chanâ€™s Waterclub, loved the open kitchen, you can watch the chefs prepare your meal! For a light breakfast there is a deli that serves fresh brewed Starbucks coffee as well as fresh bakery. To stay in touch there is a business center. There is a convenient car rental office as well. There are a lot of things to do, but just in case you run out of ideas ask the concierge, they were very helpful. I will be taking a cruise in a couple of months and I think we will stay at this place again, everything worked out perfectly besides it is close to the pier. One tip: it has a coin laundry, great for long trips.

Reviews.Title: “Decent pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: loprof
Reviews.Content: We chose the Doubletree Grand Hotel Biscayne Bay because it was relatively close to the Port of Miami and we would be boarding a cruise the next day. The hotel was fairly nice -- except one of two elevators wasn't working and we were constantly jammed into the one available elevator with way too many people. The pool was okay, but would have been a lot nicer if the bar was open. It looks like they built a bar area by the pool but don't staff it. Kind of a bummer. The room was nice, no complaints there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: idkjames
Reviews.Content: The room service staff were not very prompt but other than that the hotel was pretty nice. The staff at desk was decent. The rooms were very nice and clean though. Plenty to do at the hotel. View is pretty decent. The parking is valet only. It took several calls to room service staff before they finally picked up the tray in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jeninin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before driving down to Key West. Here's what I thought: Parking: You cannot park yourself, you have to valet. It's a little hard to see, but just pull into the driveway and then park in front of the door and valet will greet you. The hotel: Hotel was very modern and nice. People do live in this building so don't be surprised to see lots of people walking their dogs on a leash in the lobby or kids riding their bikes. Check-in: Smooth-no issues (HIlton Points). The room: Had a view of the bay-nice! There were balcony doors in the room, but they do not open. I buzzed the front desk and they said that was just for maintenance, ok then. Fitness room-awesomel!! Not your typical dinky fitness room. Bay area: The bay is the reason I chose this area. I thought there might be a place to walk outside along the bay. There is, BUT there is just a short side walk for people to access their boats. Nothing special. Location: Nothing to do in this area and no place to walk to. If you want to do or see anything cool, you have to drive over to Miami Beach. Overall it's a nice quiet hotel, but I like to be where there is action, so I will probably stay in Miami Beach next time.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are great for the price! Great views from balcony!”
Reviews.Author: PRISCILLAGAVIOLI
Reviews.Content: Staff are extremely friendly and helpful! The room was big, clean and with great views from the balcony! It is not very far from South beach, you can drive if you have hired a car like we did and park at South beach. Parking is not cheap but may be worth it. The hotel is also very close to the downtown bus centre so you can also get a bus to the South beach and save on parking money... A taxi from this hotel to the beach will cost U$$15,00 each way... Parking and breakfast are not included, still we would definitely go back again because we liked the rooms, views from balcony and staff service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: VistaDelMarExuma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the DoubleTree on Saturday, May 28th, by taxi from MIA. We were graciously greeted by the doorman who immediately took care of handling our luggage. The front desk personnel promptly checked us in and, to my wifeâ€™s delight; we were given two warm chocolate chip cookies, which my wife immediately declared as hers. I was able to get a quick bite and it was delicious. When we checked into our condo, we noticed that there was a problem with the bathroom light fixture. I called the front desk and a service rep was there to correct the problem about the time I hung up the phone. We found ALL of the staff (front desk, security, maids, doormen, etc.) to be of very cordial, almost like welcoming us into their own home. The hotel has numerous amenities, including four restaurants (Tony Chanâ€™s and Primoâ€™s were both fabulous), a deli/grocery/liquor store, dry cleaners, and my wifeâ€™s favorite, a beauty salon. Taxi service was readily available and, so, we didnâ€™t need a car. However, on three days I needed to rent one and there was an Enterprise Leasing Company on site and again the service was excellent. Constantine, the manager, made sure that everything was set for my reservations, and the return service was quite easy. I had the opportunity to meet Mr. Michal Hunter, one of the DoubleTree Managers, and told him of our very pleasant experience. All in all, our stay at the DoubleTree Grand Hotel, which went from May 28th through Sunday, June 19th, was excellent. Ronney & Jim Newman, Bahamas

Reviews.Title: “A few highs and lows”
Reviews.Author: Aspen21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a rewards stay with my family for one night on June 14. I was looking for a room with two doubles and a fold-out couch (we had three adults and a 4-year old that sleeps with one of us depending on his mood). Upon making my reservation both the national reservation line AND the hotel reservations desk stated they do not offer a room with a fold-out couch. As a result we ended up paying for an adjacent room. Arrival and check-in was a positive experience as was the room appearance and the hotel did upgrade our rooms to bay view rooms as opposed to the city view rooms normally given for reward stays. Upon getting to the room and checking the couch, it was indeed a fold out, so we ended up paying for an extra room we really didn't need:( Being in Miami, we were all looking forward to some pool time and maybe a few cocktails while there. We headed straight to the pool assuming we could get drinks and towels there (as with almost any Miami hotel). Neither were available which was disappointing. We later learned that the hotel is part hotel part condominiums therefore we needed to provide our own of each (we didn't think to bring the towels from the room). We ended up calling room service for drinks and after much haggling, they contacted housekeeping for us to bring us all towels- we had already gotten in the pool. The AC in the rooms is louder than the majority of hotels I've stayed at. The internet was free given I was an Honors member, $9.95 daily otherwise. Parking was $29 daily (pretty standard for Miami hotels). A big positive was that I forgot my watch in the room. I called two days later and housekeeping had found it! They over-nighted my watch to me at no charge which was above and beyond. Overall, I would recommend staying at the regular Hilton (1 block away) as they have larger rooms and a full service pool area for the same rates (and for fewer points if you're on a rewards stay).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel very close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: KeithnAlly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. In town for a bit of work and a bit of vacation. Hotel was wonderful! Very safe and close to everything. We took the free public train to Bayside and did some shopping and had dinner. Awesome place for couples, singles, or families. Upgraded to condo with a huge balcony and most comfortable bed ever! Grabbed the bus just down the street to South Beach. Park just next door for outdoor activities. Loved it and will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Treated Very Nicely!”
Reviews.Author: sandibeach
Reviews.Content: I am now a regular at the Doulbetree for business trips. Front desk is extremely friendly and Krystal is sales is amazing! Restaurant is good and view over marina looking onto Miami is lovely..

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for pre cruise”
Reviews.Author: rykmac44
Reviews.Content: Despite reading some of the reviews on here, we decided to book the Cruise Package. I was very pleased with everything, from when we arrived to check out. We flew into the Ft Lauderdale airport and took a car service to the hotel. No hassle checking in and yes, the cookies are delicious! Once we got settled we asked downstairs to get familiar with the area. Within the hotel there is a liquor store, a couple restaurants and clothing stores. We decided to walk to Bayside. It was about a 10-15 minute walk but well worth it. All of the restaurants surround the marina (Hard Rock CafÃ©, Chiliâ€™s, Hooters) and there are stores (Gap, Footlocker) as well as souvenir shops. The pool is clean, quiet and warm! The Cruise Package included breakfast and transportation to the Port of Miami along with a great view of the ships. Everything was clean and in working order. After our cruise we had some time before flying out of the Miami Airport so we went back to the hotel. They gave us pool access, towels and luggage storage â€“ there was no fee for this. This also allowed us to use the fitness facility for showering and freshening up before heading to the airport. The Doubletree exceeded my expectations!! It is a great place to stay pre/post cruise!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Jinty_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night and didn't really get the chance to explore this hotel and facilities. Reception - good - given a fantastic cookie! Room lovely, but carpet frayed along tile edge. Bathroom excellent, but a bit short on toiletries, such as shower cap! 2 double beds and very comfortable, but why spoil luxury by putting the duvet between sheets instead of in a cover? Air con noisy! There is a balcony and it took a lot of effort to open the doors and 2 of us to close them! We were charged for the minibar which hadn't been used - this was refunded. There was a lack of information in the hotel lobby for surrounding areas. No leaflets that could be picked up. For an expensive hotel, why did they deem it necessary to charge us to leave luggage in storage for the day - per bag!!!!! The hotel is near the metro mover, but if you don't have a car, you'd be better nearer Bayside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice loacation, good value”
Reviews.Author: NeilandBarbara
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights between running the Boston Marathon and boarding a cruise. We chose this hotel for its location near to the airport and the cruise terminal and wanted a nice pool and a sea view, and at a good price. We got it all here. Short cab from journey from Miami International Airport. Nice reception and pleasant helpful staff. Quick check in. We were on the 9th floor. Pool was on the 6th I think. Room was a good size, clean and with all required facilities. We paid a little extra for the bay view, which was well worth it. Really nice views of the marina and Miami beach further on. Good size balcony. Good size bathroom with a nice shower. Comfy beds and nice pillows. We slept very well. On the ground floor are some shops and a few restaurants and bars. You need them, as there is very little within walking distance. We did find a supermarket, but a bit of a walk. You can get everything you need in the ground floor area. We ate at the Italian both nights. Pleasant food for a hotel and a nice atmosphere. Unlike the reviewer below, we only saw a few people smoking around the pool and it did not cause a problem. We found the pool area to be clean, with plenty of chairs and great views of the marina and bay. Again the hot tub area was very pleasant. Free wifi in all areas. There is no real balcony area outside of the bars, but the adjacent hotel (Marriot I think) has a really nice, cool balcony area with good seating. Well worth a visit . So much better value than staying on Miami beach if you are pre or post cruise, but don't walk around the area, as there is nothing to see. A convenient place to stay for a few nights. Neil

Reviews.Title: “Go if you want to Die of Lung Cancer”
Reviews.Author: balletmom182
Reviews.Content: Smoking is allowed everywhere. People smoked in the pool and hot tub. Blowing smoke into everyone's face, including children. The butts were floating in pool, hot tub and all over the grounds, including inside the hotel. Never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Rough start but Management more than made up for it...”
Reviews.Author: Dargarov
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Miami on business recently and took the family along for Spring Break. We checked into this hotel at 10 p.m. on a Monday night and asked for an upgrade to a bay view room (Hilton Gold / Booked a City view room). According to HHonors T&C's, we were entitled to a space available upgrade and free continental breakfast. Didn't receive either upon check in. Spent the first night squeezed into a double bed with my wife...woke up to a screaming baby in the next room at 5 a.m. On a whim, I tried to book a bogus reservation in the hotel just to see if any upgraded rooms were available for the remainder of our stay. Lo and behold...Bay view hotel, 1br, and 2 br condos were all available. Went to front desk, told the agent what I'd discovered and requested an upgrade. Was told that I'd have to speak to the manager (Christine) when she came in at 9 a.m. Also requested breakfast coupons for my family which were provided without hesitation. My wife dropped me off at work and went back to the hotel to speak to Christine after 9 a.m. Presto! Keys to an AWESOME 2 br condo were waiting for her at the desk. The good: Condo was incredible with fabulous views of the city and bay. Cookies at check in were a hit with the kids. Tin of cookies and personal note sent to condo by Christine apologizing for the first night. The bad: Mandatory $29 per night valet parking. Requested coffee refills three separate times in one evening and never received it. As a Hilton Honors member with Gold status, I felt like we had to scrap and claw for everything that we were entitled to according to the terms and conditions of the program.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay the Night Before a Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Foghorn8508
Reviews.Content: Flew into FLL and took SAS transportation to the hotel. Front desk staff was nice. Room overlooked the water. Furniture was a bit dated, but clean. Shower pressure very good (always important to me.) We did not pay for a hotel included breakfast in our reservation, but did take the advice of the Concierge and took a safe ten minute walk to "The Daily". Food was very good and worth the short walk. The hotel is a $6 cab ride to the waterfront shopping and $11 trip to the Port of Miami wher our ship was. Hotel is adjacent to condos with small shops and restaurants. We had dinner at the sports bar on the second level that was not too bad. Taxis were always around and available. Only downside was that the room was a good distance from the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience turned into a disaster”
Reviews.Author: Tampa_Jersh
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel earlier this week. I read a number of reviews and there seemed to be mixed emotions about this place, but given the proximity to Jackson Memorial / UM Medical Campus I decided to give it a shot. Upon arrival they informed me that I had been upgraded from a standard king room to a condo. This was before they knew I was a Diamond Hilton Honors member, so they must have just been way under booked for the night. The condo was HUGE, I would guess it was close to 1,000 sq. ft. It certainly showed its age but it was clean and very comfortable. It had 2 bathrooms, a fully equiped kitchen, a full living room with nice size TV, a huge walk-in closet off the bedroom, and also a washer/dryer combo. The staff were friendly and my request for foam pillows was addressed very quickly by housekeeping. So all-in-all my stay up until the moment I left was pleasant and I was going to leave a nice review. HOWEVER, that all went to the garbage basket real quick. This hotel is located in the heart of downtown Miami, so the only parking they have is valet. No biggie, I left my car with the valet folks and assumed that it would be parked in a secure area in the hotel/condo buildings parking garage. Upon retrieving my car the next morning, I opened my glove box to retrieve my GPS and it was gone. Upon further inspection I also discovered that my iPod had also been removed, as well as all the loose change that was under the arm-rest in the console (every last single penny). I sell microscopes and had a $30,000 system in a box in the back that the thief ripped open. Thankfully they were stupid and didn't touch anything inside the box. I'm about 99% certain that this was an inside job by someone working for the valet company. My car doors automatically lock 5 minutes after the keys are removed if they aren't locked by the driver. Therefore, unless they left it unlocked and someone got into it within the first 5 minutes of it being parked, then someone from the company used my keys to get in and pilfer it. Bottom line - my hotel stay was very pleasant, however the deadbeats that work for the valet company totally spoiled my stay. If you choose to use the valet, make sure you remove ALL valuables, even if they are not in plain sight (I obviously just learned that the hard way).

Reviews.Title: “Worth what you pay”
Reviews.Author: chileandreamin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a convenient spot almost within 15 minutes by car of any area worth a mention like South Beach. Hotel is a little tired but clean. Rooms are comfortable. My colleagues tell me the internet is variable...I had no issues. The breakfast venue is a not a hotel run restaurant and I was put into the apartments side of the hotel as opposed to the hotel. I got an apartment and this has been quite nice however, this wasn't explained to me at reception. The staff have been friendly and helpful especially the doorman and concierge. The reception staff did their jobs and nothing more. All over, not bad given what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “completely unacceptable in every way”
Reviews.Author: jhl_srh
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. I had to change rooms 3 times. The first had hairs all in the bed and a major bug infestation crawling all over the bathroom and room. They moved me to the condo side, which was worse. The stains on the bed made me want to vomit and the room was just a mess. Pieces of the floor board were missing, there were stains everywhere, wires hanging out, and the shower was the most disgusting, moldy, greenish blue goopy nastiness I had ever seen. My 3rd room had hair in the sink, crumbs all over the floor, trash had not been emptied, and there was an old newspaper thrown about the bathroom. The front desk staff was rude and asked if I wanted to check out (it was midnight at this point and I had no where to go). They finally agreed to send a cleaning team upstairs to clean the room (she was so sweet, btw... the only positive thing about this hotel was the lady who cleaned the room). She was horrified when she saw the condition of the room and very apologetic. In the midst of all this, the elevator broke, trapping me inside. When I finally go the doors to open, they slammed shut immediately as I was walking out and the elevator dropped a few inches, catching my toe in the riff. I was told the manager was on vacation but I arranged to speak with the front desk manager. I had told the staff that I would be back to talk to her on my lunch break (giving the exact time) but when I arrived, she had "stepped out for lunch." I asked when she wouold be leaving for the day and I was told 7:00pm. I told the desk staff that I would be back by 6:30 to meet with her. When I rushed back from my meeting and asked for her, I was told she had left 3 hours ago! I finally talked to her the next day and showed her the photodocumentation of the gross conditions. She did not seem phased but said she was going to give me 70,000 HH points (but would not reiumburse the room charges). She also left a bottle of wine in my room which was inappropriate considering the nature of the conference I was attending. I would normally appreciate wine, but it was just awkward that it was left there on my last day and I could not carry it back on the airplane unless I wanted to pay to check my bag. Anyway, 2 weeks later I still had not received my points in my account (I was told it would take 7-10 days) so I called the HH hotline. They told me (even though I had it in writing) that the hotel had never submitted anything about the points. Thankfully the customer service people at HH are very nice and made up for it with more bonus points. I may add the pictures later so you can see for yourself just how gross this place is!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pool”
Reviews.Author: jrkho5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for just 1 night and were happy with the location, shopping, and resturants, but the most surprising thing was the fantastic pool area...Lovely view, large and well kept, and the whirlpool was fabulous. The only drawbacks were the views from the rooms weren't that great and the room was only typical of a nice hotel. Staff was helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel/ location/ room”
Reviews.Author: am11111
Reviews.Content: despite what some have written about this place, the room was huge/ view wonderful/ furnishing great/ clean / up to date, and we would have gladly paid more to stay there. yes there is $30's per night for parking, but that's not hidden , your told that up front.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: becreyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Doubletree one night before leaving for a cruise. It was everything we wanted/needed and more!! We wanted one with a pool and close to the port. The pool is amazing, the rooms are amazing and the hotel itself is great with all the shops and places to eat! Definitely a great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably good”
Reviews.Author: JavierGS
Reviews.Content: I just visited the Doubletree Grand hotel in Miami a couple of weeks ago. It is of reasonably good quality although it has some strange items. The hotel is just 3 floors of the complete building, and it lacks of services, e.g. it does not provide breakfasts or dinners. On the other hand, the hotel has some shopping areas next to it where you can have breakfast or dinner, so it is OK unless you are there for a long stay. Within 15-20 min walking distance to downtown (although there is really nothing to see in downtown miami) and close to miami mover as free transportation. the bus to the outlet dolphin mall stops next to the hotel (in front of the marriott which is adjacent). The rooms are large (junior suite type), the decoration and bathrooms are outdated but the bed is great. The area can be noisy and the sound isolation is not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great times at the Doubletree Grand Biscayne Bay- Miami”
Reviews.Author: TTGtrip
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Doubletree Grand Biscayne Bay- Miami during a quick getaway and had a wonderful time! The staff was great and so accomodating. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place to lodge--whether for leisure or pleasure. -Tia G.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly souless service and disregard for guests”
Reviews.Author: chuckm2003
Reviews.Content: Perhaps one of the most souless hotels I have ever stayed at. The only interaction I had with hotel staff was when I requested a one-hour late checkout and they refused - and not that politely either. The physical plant is showing its age. No cell service in the meeting rooms either. There are so many better choices available. Avoid if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Traveler012511
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here 2 days prior to our cruise. Check in was a breeze, and they even upgraded us up to a condo with a view of the bay and the city, at no extra cost to us! The rooms were nice and spacious, the kitchen was fully stocked with everything we needed (except the food) . They had stores, restaurants, bars downstairs in the hotel. We felt like we were living the good life The metro was within walking distance. And when we had a problem with our internet, the maintennce man was right there, even at 10:30 at night! Everyone was friendly and helpful!! We even got our famous Starbucks cookie during check in. I would recommend this place to anyone who would be traveling to Miami!! Can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: CurvyDivaLady
Reviews.Content: Great place, awesome staff, good location, friendly and quick valet, very comfy rooms. I have absolutely NO complaints. I already have reservations to stay there again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Bunnydots
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were booked on a cruise out of the Port of Miami and we needed to arrive a day early to make sure we could make our boarding time. I picked this hotel based on decent reviews and because I'm an HHonors member and could get some amenities like free Internet and HHonors points. Room price was in the 260 dollar/night range for a balcony room which worked out to 130 for each of us, not bad for this expensive area. Our room was very large (I was expecting something about half the size) with a sitting area, double bed for each of us with nice linens and pillows, two sinks (which helped a lot when we were rushing in the morning to get ready to go) and big balcony with view of a marina and chairs for sitting out there. The bathroom contained a toilet, bidet (which I could have done without - I'm not a bidet person) and a pretty ordinary tub and shower. I would have liked a deeper or nicer tub but overall the bathroom was OK. There was also a minibar which was missing half the things on its menu but there was also a nice big bottle of red wine for purchase in the room at not too much money (16 dollars which in my experience with hotel minibars usually gets you about a half-size bottle rather than the large bottle this one was). Bottled water was complimentary which was also nice. I used the business center to print out some cruise documents and found the computers and printer in good working order, easy to use and there were four terminals so I didn't have to wait to print out. The wi-fi in the room worked pretty well and like I said I get it for free as an HHonors member rather than pay the 9.95/ day charge. The hotel is also attached to a mini-mall with a couple of restaurants and some fashion and sundries stores. The concierge was helpful, greeting me on arrival and helping us get transportation to the Port of Miami. The desk staff were also friendly and helpful with answering questions and getting our bill split between two credit cards. As others have noted, the lobby is very small which is a problem when a bunch of people with large luggage all arrive at once. There was also a free breakfast included with our room, which turned into a hassle as we first could not find the restaurant serving the breakfast. Turned out there are two places serving it but they are both at the very end of the attached mini-mall rather than in the hotel itself; one place is a grab-and-go and the other is a sit-down restaurant with very few tables. After we finally found the breakfast place, we discovered our free breakfast only included a bagel, coffee and juice - no eggs or anything - and we had to have a special voucher to get it, though we eventually did get it. I would rather skip the "free breakfast" and have them knock a few bucks off the room price as it seemed to be more of a gimmick to get you into the restaurants and get you to order other things not included in the freebie, than a convenience for the hotel guests. Also, this hotel is not really walking distance to the Port or to nearby markets, nor is it convenient to downtown Miami, and when my friend tried to take a taxi to a party downtown the cabbie got lost and couldn't find the club. Overall we had a good experience, though, and I would stay here again especially if I was planning to hang around the hotel (like business trip or pre-cruise) and not be going out and about in the city too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Grand, wonderful”
Reviews.Author: havlyn
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel the rooms were immaculate. Large pool and four hot tubes. There is a shopping plaza in lobby area and there are complimentary cookies at check in. The staff were very polite and accommodating. The hotel is very conveniently located near stores and the free metro loop is opposite hotel. The only problem is there is no parking and valet parking is $29.00

Reviews.Title: “Almost flawless”
Reviews.Author: mrcoury
Reviews.Content: The rooms have an excellent size but no flat TVs, the bathroom is excellent. The staff could be a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Great views...friendly staff....decent location....rooms average”
Reviews.Author: HOaKIE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. We picked the Doubletree for its location close to Miami/SoBE/Key Biscayne plus I could get a decent room using Hilton Honors points. My Honors level got me an automatic upgrade to a room overlooking Key Biscayne. We were on the 7th floor right above the marina and had good views of Miami Beach and the bay. The hotel is easy to find. Only valet parking ($29/day) but it was very efficient. The hotel shares space with some sort of condo complex so there are shops, bars & restaurants in the complex. The hotel breakfast was offered at one of the restaurants. The hotel isn't as impressive as the web site photos show. The hallways are a bit narrow and somewhat dark. The king bed room we had was OK. Having two sinks was a big plus and one was outside the shower which was nice. No fridge in the room but they did have a mini bar fridge. The prices were not that outrageous. It had a balcony where we could sit and watch the sunrise over the bay & marina and that was very nice. Overall, the room was OK but not spectacular. The location was close to one of the main causeways over to Miami Beach so that was very convenient. The area around the hotel consisted of other hotels, condos and some sort of arena/venue for shows & operas. We did not walk around the area at all because we did not readily see shops or restaurants within walking distance. May have been there...we just didn't see them. Overall, our stay was fine. The front desk was helpful and check in/out was fine. The valet parking was very efficient. I'm not sure I would stay here again if I went back. I would probably find a hotel with a more impressive lobby and nicer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Lots of Amenities”
Reviews.Author: sallywallerman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights at the beginning of a vacation/trip to South Florida with my two adult children (ages 24 & 26.) The hotel sits right on Biscayne Bay with great views of the Bay, the Miami Beach strip, and the Atlantic beyond. We opted for the "condo" room which had 3 bedrooms though I had reserved a 2-bedroom condo. The rate was cheaper then what 2 hotel rooms would have cost, plus we had 2 bathrooms, a full kitchen with ice maker/water dispenser on the fridge door, a large living room, and an expansive deck with comfortable deck chairs and lounger. We were on one of the upper floors with superb views. From our deck I saw 2 manatees in the marina right below our hotel. My kids went down and took great photos while viewing them close at hand. While in Miami we were centrally located to: dinner in Little Havana (go to Versailles restaurant and be sure to drop in on the bakery next door to bring a few delicious items back to your hotel - on SW 8th Street); a short drive over to South Beach; a free people-mover electric tram over to AA Arena for a Miami Heat game; a drive to the everglades for a short airboat tour of the alligators and birds native to the glades; and a not too long of a drive to Sawgrass Mills Mall for great retail and outlet shopping, just northwest of Miami. The hotel has a full boutique shopping mall on the bottom floor with pharmacy, groceries and liquor store. There are also several restaurants on site of which we only had time to try the one at the front of the hotel which had a great bar menu and friendly bartenders. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree Grand Biscayne Bay and would highly recommend the condo "rooms' for a family or group of 3 or more.

Reviews.Title: “hotel was fine, but concierge behavior was horrible”
Reviews.Author: 4thlaker
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the hotel for one night. We booked it at the last minute, and got a good rate, and were thrilled with the view of Biscayne Bay from our room on the 9th floor. We loved the hot tub area - 4 separate tubs but all connected, so there was plenty of room and privacy. What marred the experience was the concierge. We called to inquire about boat tours of Miami on Biscayne Bay, which we had seen advertised in the tourism brochures, and the concierge told us that she would be happy to make the arrangements. She told us that it would cost $39 per person, and that we would be picked up at the hotel and dropped off after, and that we would have to pay her a $30 deposit. What she failed to mention was that the $39 was the rate if you booked the boat trip through Safari Tours. If you just went over to Bayside, where the boats left from and booked the tour through the boat company, it was $26 a person. Bayside was only a 10 minute walk from the hotel. We didn't know any of this at the time, and agreed to the $39. When the driver picked us up (a half hour late), he informed us that the $39 per person rate did not include tax. When he walked us over to the boat company, we realized that the boat ride was only $26 per person, including tax. At that point we told him we were cancelling, and he told us we owed a $30 transportation fee for the ride from the hotel, which we refused to pay. I understand that there are kickbacks in this industry, and if the concierge has a deal with a tour company, that is their business, as long as it does not cost the guest extra money. Here we were not advised that this was through a tour company, and that we could simply walk over and book the boat trip ourselves for $48 less. When we got back to the hotel we talked to the manager on duty, who advised that the concierge service was outsourced. So I can't blame the hotel entirely, but they do have some responsibility. They took our information, and promised to pass it along to the general manager, who was out of town. We have not yet heard back from them.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant outside, average inside.”
Reviews.Author: BackstreetsBack
Reviews.Content: Although I loved the comfortable feel of the room, there isn't much that sets it apart from other similar rated hotels. The driveway and lobby of the hotel look quite exquisite, but the guest room we stayed in wasn't as much so. We had to walk almost a full circle from the elevators, pull our suitcases up a few steps of stairs before we were able to find our room. After such exercise, you'd think we'd be in for a nice view or something, but nope! The window revealed a scene to nowhere. Well, more like a partial wall, some plants, and what seemed to be some sort of roof top patio/outdoor lounge. The service was great - desk clerks always greeted us and of course the welcome cookie was a nice surprise. But gestures like this are overshadowed by dissatisfying things such as having to pay ridiculous amounts for internet, which most respectable hotels extend as a complimentary feature. Also, the cleanliness of the hotel is questionable for I had found a pubic hair lying in front of the bathtub in plain sight. I understand housekeepers are only human and they can miss spots. But having something like that lying around is just gross, and the reason why I walk around wearing thick socks (or slippers provided by the hotel, which in this case was not). With all this said, this is not a bad hotel. It is a nice hotel. However, nice is not good enough to keep guests from coming back. For the rate we paid, I felt this hotel possessed a 'thrifty' attitude. It lacked things other hotels would have provided/included, and also did not offer shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “What an Upgrade if you can get one!”
Reviews.Author: DB54
Reviews.Content: when we booked the hotel it was more a matter of being near the miami dock than anything else and it was just for one night. But what a night as after we booked it we were offered an some upgrades with a bay view for a mere $39.00. The price of the hotel since we booked rather late was $171.00 that includes the state and city tax. The rates would be cheaper if booked in the non- season. You don't know if you get the upgrade however until you arrive It is a AAA diamond rated hotel and has valet and a parking garage. Who knew as the pictures speak for itself as this place (a condominium 1 br) was on the 20th floor, had a full kitchen. The only downside was some wear on the furniture but other than that it was fully equipped with a dishwasher, over under clothes washer/dryer, microwave. The only downside was the bath water which was more lukewarm than hot. There was a double balcony that one enters from the bedroom or the living room and there was a TV in both. Spacious with 1 1/2 baths.
