The room service like all hotels is pricey but $60.00 (with tip) for breakfast may seem alot but the waffles were HUGE and surrounded by some of the best strawberries we have had. There were two places we had meals at that we will review with one of them for lunch at Primos (supposedly Primo's downtown Miami's #1 choice for Italian Food) and the other Le Faubourg Deli. It must have been a bad day at Primos as if this #1 we are in trouble as the Deli had better food. The service at Primos was one of the worst we have seen in a long time, There is also a pharmacy and a liquor store also nearby. They also offer a shuttle for $7.50/person to the miami docks that start leaving at 11:30 on the 1/2 hour until 1:30. You catch the van at the entrance to the hotel. So except for the Primos negative experience it was a great way to get ready for the cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and cookies upon arrival!”
Reviews.Author: jesserows
Reviews.Content: I'll have to disagree with some of the negative review for Doubletree. I didn't have a condo room, but one that had fabulous views of Biscayne Bay with a nice furnished balcony. The front desk and concierge staff were professional and friendly. The concierge recommended a great breakfast place called The Daily just down the road. The hotel is really lovely with a large, clean room and bathroom. No fancy robes, flat screen TVs etc, but good basic accommodation especially for business travelers. If you were a tourist, however, I would recommend considering a different location. The only complaint I have is that the charge for parking/valet isn't posted or communicated clearly, so just beware that it's a $29 fee.

Reviews.Title: “A little worn around the edges...”
Reviews.Author: FL410
Reviews.Content: An okay hotel. They upgraded us to a condo unit -- very large and well furnished. It didn't quite have the bay FRONT view we requested, but it was still a decent view. The corridors in the hotel are quite bleak looking. The rooms, though clean, could use some TLC -- new grout in the bathrooms, better locking doors on the balconies, etc. The small shopping center attached to this hotel is a plus. There are several restaurants in the shopping area. The two we chose were decent, though not great. Would we stay here again? Maybe, but we'd probably try somewhere else first. One major sin for this hotel: Their signature cookies were way overcooked and very hard!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: chundell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near American Airlines arena and the opera house andd the performing arts center all within a 8 minute walk. The retail gallery connected to the hotel is a plus with its restaurants. The rooms have a balcony but the doors do not open to the patio "for your safety and security" according to the writing on the doors. The parking is valet only for $29 a day so be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Doubletree, but was not impressed with the people of Miami”
Reviews.Author: ConnieJ1156
Reviews.Content: Loved the concierge staff Carmen, Ceasar and Miguel. Loved the friendliness of the entire Doubletree staff. I was very shocked and deeply disappointed when I traveled to and shopped at Bayside and the Dolphin Mall. Out of my 50 plus years I have never been treated so badly by a business owner. (at Bayside). Then to add insult to injury I went to Dolphin Mall where I encountered sheer racism at it's worse. I can't and will not repeat what happened to my husband and myself. I live in Chicago with a very diverse group of people and never have I had to deal with prejudice and hatred like I did at Bayside and the Dolphin Mall. Florida generates a lot of their revenue through tourism therefore the residents need to learn diversity and tolerance of others. They need to learn to be friendly and courtesy to others, not just their own, but let it extend to those that they don't know.

Reviews.Title: “Well at least it was a low rate...”
Reviews.Author: TCBusiness
Reviews.Content: The rate was low and the photos looked great. It was convenient to downtown business meetings. Then I got there and checked in and they 'upgraded' me to a one-bedroom condo unit overlooking the Bay, but... The room had holes in the walls and the $10 artwork on the walls were all damaged -- seemed like there must have been an angry guest there before me. There was no electric in the bedroom (no lights, no tv), although there was electric in the living room. The unit next to mine had a smoke detector incessantly beeping. My colleague had no better experience in his room... I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time!”
Reviews.Author: nadyu2002
Reviews.Content: My family took me to Miami for my birthday and it was the best time of my life. We barely left the place. The personnel was nice and friendly, rooms were clean and fresh. Swimming pool was exceptionally clean and nice. Overall, great place, I would recommend for family reunions.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great”
Reviews.Author: travellingklatt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to visit friends in town. The scenery and service were both great. It was also very conveniently located and made meeting my friends and seeing the town very easy. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Doubletree Grand Hotel Biscayne Bay is my number one choice of hotel in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: kbachar
Reviews.Content: A few of my company's key consultants travel to Miami for business everyweek and the staff at the Doubletree has made an effort to get to know them on a personal basis and make them feel like they are at home. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are beautiful and the view is amazing. Top leadership staff works with us on a regular basis to make sure our needs are met and we are satisfied with the hotel and service. We are very satisfied and glad to be partnering with them for our hotel needs in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyawayCA
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a place to stay the night before our cruise. The room was spectacular. We had a balcony and a view of the bay. The bed in the room was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in (and I have stayed at many, many hotels). I wanted to carry it out and bring it home with me. The hotel staff here were excellent. Especially the front desk staff who I kept approaching to ask random hotel/taxi type questions. They were very friendly and did not seem bothered by me. This hotel is great because there are so many restaurants attached to it. You can basically find anything you could want to eat. They had Chinese, Italian, a place that sold hamburgers and the like, plus a deli serving Starbucks. For dinner we ate at Primo's the Italian restaurant. It was a small and dimly lit restaurant with outstanding food. It was delicious! For those heading off to a cruise the next morning just go right out front and taxis will be there waiting for you.

Reviews.Title: “Double Tree Biscayne Bay is 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: jhammill
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service Very convenient location Incredible views Great amenities Very comfortable beds

Reviews.Title: “I was amazed by our room, I wanted to move in!”
Reviews.Author: MrsHappy427
Reviews.Content: I noted that we traveled for leisure but truly it was mixed, the first day I went on business why my husband and kids roamed around and then we stayed the weekend and completely relaxed. We had an amazing room with the bath area splitting the room in half between the living area and bedroom which was GREAT for putting our little one down for naps in the bedroom and entertaining our older daughter in the living room. Even though it is listed as a studio it really feels like two rooms! The balcony was tiny but sufficed to enjoy the water views. Room service was quick and good! AND the best is that they have shops in the hotel and the deli/grocery is fantastic! We were able to pick up all sorts of snacks and prepared foods to avoid the repeated room service charges. They even had a LARGE selection of adult beverages for after the kids went to bed. The only drawback I could possibly think of is that they only have valet parking so if you are hoping to save a buck parking your own car look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Miami”
Reviews.Author: JAC039
Reviews.Content: We experienced a great pre-cruise location and cruise package. Hotel greeted with a warm chocolate cookie which was just a hint of the good service that followed. Our large room had a nice view of the bay and package included breakfast and transportation to ship. Employee arranged a city tour round trip to hotel. All was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Grand indeed!”
Reviews.Author: davidandcindy
Reviews.Content: Sept 23 - 27 visiting our daughter at UM. Booked a Jr. Suite overlooking Biscayne Bay, we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom condo that was spectacular! Staff was friendly and professional, facilities were excellent. On-site shopping/dining were a pleasant surprise, location was perfect. We are looking forward to returning in May for our daughters graduation.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Lcolla
Reviews.Content: I searched for awhile for a hotel to do a park and cruise package. I was nervous about the reviews but I called several times to confirm all the details regarding the package and thought it would go smooth. I was wrong they claimed I booked the package wrong meanwhile I have the email conformation in my hand showing I booked a park and cruise and that Parking was included. After that whenever I got my car out of the valet parking I was asked for payment I had to explain I did the package and that parking was included it was a hassle whenever I got my car. Then the construction right next to the hotel starts at 8am so no sleeping in and the morning of checkout the toliet didn't work I told them upon Checkout and it didnt seem to bother them. Would never stay there again hire a staff that knows why there doing and maybe I will reconsider

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room with lovely water view. Courteous and professional staff.”
Reviews.Author: corybrighton
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. My room was well appointed, very quiet with excellent bed and ample space. Balcony with lovely view of the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Beautiful, Great accommodation”
Reviews.Author: mroshto
Reviews.Content: Best time ever and the hotel was exceptional. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great Sleep, Great Bar”
Reviews.Author: kittravel
Reviews.Content: The main drawback is the hotel does not have a shuttle to the airport, but taxi's are in front and less than $20 outside of rush hours. Rooms are pleasant, well-lit, with views of Biscayne Bay and the bridge. Best part is primos Restaurant and Lounge off the lobby. Vitello Picante was perfect and the (female) bartender happy, friendly, quick, and had a good sense of humor.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service at the doubletree”
Reviews.Author: Aridely
Reviews.Content: The front desk agent when i was checking in was very rude. When I booked my reservation I requested an upgraded room at an additional cost. I was advised online that this would be based on availability which is understandable. When I checked in i was not greeted. She just asked my name checked me in didn't even hand me the warm cookies. When I asked a out the upgrade she had no clue what I was talking about. She went to ask the supervisor and the answer I received was we no longer do that. I was very upset that u have that option when you nook it online but when u check In they tell u no. I didn't even get an apology. Then my stay got worse. The room attendant did an awful job cleaning the room. My towels where not replaced I had to call down several times to get them. The toilet wad clogged and again I called several times to have someone fix it. After it was fixed the engineer said he would send someone to clean the bathroom. No one came so again I had go call and request this to be done. I travel to Florida quite often and i will definitely not stay here again. I must say however the valet parking attendant where great and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & Understanding Front Desk Saved my Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Davidquimbayo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best hotels my family and I have stayed in. After realizing the previous hotel we booked was not what we expected, we searched the area for a hotel with a decent price and room. Instead, we found the Doubletree which offered an amazing price, and a incredible room. More importantly, the front desk person made this possible with his understanding of our situation. Thanks Nick!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best experience despite of staying in over 50 hotels wordwide”
Reviews.Author: BollywoodPS
Reviews.Content: The best located, clean, amazing views, superb staff, fantastik service, value for the money and safety serves it all. Despite of Marriott and Hilton around it Doubletree is par excellence incl for family or a party crew.

Reviews.Title: “service is horrible”
Reviews.Author: bride201007
Reviews.Content: i never read a review on a hotel but after this experience i will..the services is awful they hire characters from movies and supervisor with a name after a drink. they are the rudest front desk clerks have ever encounter. they were not friendly or even willing to help. hotels is outdated but housekeeping staff is nice. valet is a little higher then expected but they were nice.ask to speak to a front desk manager and was told no managers on the weekend not even the general manager. so our concern were not herd. was here to plan a wedding and accomadations for our guest. i would be a crazy bride if i would use this hotel.. will never stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a "Grand" hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GPalmer25
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the negative reviews, Doubletree Grand Hotel and it's staff are wonderful! I reserved a room approximately 2 months in advance, later I went on the internet and started reading some of the reviews and got very concerned. I contemplated canceling, but decided I'll judge for myself and was I happy I did. We arrived at approximately 3 pm, we were told that our room will be ready in 15 minutes, I thought ohoh, here we go, the reviews were right. I advised the front desk staff we had family waiting for us and could not spare the extra 15 minutes, right away she found a room that ready and checked us in. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and spacious. I would absolutely stay there again. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice hotel, would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Simplynitty
Reviews.Content: This absolutely gorgeous hotel (left half hotel, right half condos) is right ON the marina. We had a king size room with a balcony view on the seventh floor and I absolutely loved my room. The AC gave us just a little bit of a problem as the room would take for ever to cool, but other than that they stay was perfect. The lobby leads to an area which looks nothing short of a mall! There are restaurants (yummy food!), a deli, pharmacy, gift shop, boutique, jewelry store - pretty much anything that you can think of! I caught a cold after the second night, and was able to go straight down to the pharmacy and get me some meds! That was just truly amazing. The parking however, was WAY too pricey. Your only option is valet parking for $29/night. So on a four-night stay, we paid almost $120 for PARKING. That was truly the only downside to this hotel. I will, however, stay here again. :-)

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Vouso
Reviews.Content: For those who are not interested in night life or have a car, I would recomend this hotel. I didn't have any problem with front desk staff, cleanliness, or any other thing. I got happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “'DOUBLETREE Grand indeed"”
Reviews.Author: lissahudson
Reviews.Content: I must say this hotel is difference! But the staff was great!! Front desk was so attentive. Housekeeping came within mintues when we ask for new towels.(AND THE POOL IS AWESOME). I really enjoyed myself and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Do not go!! Hotel is nice but can do better!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mzwilliams0816
Reviews.Content: First of all when i got there the room was not prepared with the items that i had asked for. The vending machines didnt work on our floor and the ice machine. Also they had no snack machines. I had to ask for towels 4 times before I actually got them which was later that night. In order to get to our room we had to walk about a mile. Also there was no food availiable late night after 2am. They ran my credit card like crazy without my permission. There is also no shuttle bus from the airport or to different places. You have to pay for a taxi and they are competitive about telling you which taxi to take. If you drive you have to pay 29 dollars a night for parking and not for valet!!!! There was no other parking availiable. This hotel sucked!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Miami-Waterfront !!!!”
Reviews.Author: drkafie
Reviews.Content: Most people stay at a Hotel for 2-3 days and that's it. As a Hilton Honors member (Diamond) I have stayed at this hotel for longer durations, due to my business activities in Miami. It's a great hotel, it has everything you could possibly need and more. The Staff is 10+. This is the only place I stay at when I come to Miami. Dr. Kafie

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Hotel & Staff were wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: mmmatt
Reviews.Content: My nephew was having his wedding reception at the Doubletree Grand last weekend. After reading so many negative reviews, I was very concerned what we would face when we arrived. Would we be able to get a room even though we prepaid online or would they be overbooked as so many had suggested. Was the staff going to be awful to deal with? Was our room going to be dirty and in disrepair? We arrived around 1 PM and were greeted warmly by Patricia. She said our room was ready, quickly checked us in, gave us our cookies and we were off! We reserved and prepaid for a 2 double bed, balcony/bayside room on Doubletree's website. Our room was just as described. Beautiful room with a balcony facing the boat docks below us. Claudette our housekeeper for 4 days was very attentive to our needs. From the concierge to the staff for the reception and beyond...all were so friendly and willing to assist us. We spoke to the manager on our departure and assured her we were well taken care of throughout our 4 day stay. She said they have been working hard to train their employees throughout the hotel and it is obvious to us it is working!!! We had many relatives that flew in from all over the country and the only complaint I heard was someone's airconditioning was not working and they moved them to another room, no problem. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “this Doubletree give all Hilton Hotels a bad name.”
Reviews.Author: collmc
Reviews.Content: Since we would only be in Miami for about 15 hours, we didn't try too hard to find a great hotel, but afterwards, I wish we would have tried a little harder! The rooms, location, gym, etc were all average but the front desk service was pathetic. There were at least six people behind the desk when we tried to check in the first time, but it still took about 5 minutes to get someone to break from their private conversations to greet us. We were told check- in was at 3pm so we should come back then, ok, we were there at 1pm, so we understood. The doorman said the luggage area was full but we could leave our bags near their stand, ok, we didn't want to drag them around in the pouring rain. When we returned at 4 pm to try to check in again, we were told that the room was not ready but it would be in an hour or so. Maybe we were in a bad mood because we were soaking wet because there was a huge storm happening, but can someone explain why there are no rooms ready at 4 when check-out is at noon? They can not offer that explanation at the Doubletree. When we asked what they could do to make us feel better, they offered a late check-out (this technique does not work or we would have been in our room already!!). We planned to check out on time to continue our trip so they offered a free bottle of wine. So we went to the bar while we waited for our room. Of course, we paid full price for our bottle of wine because the bar said no one told them that the wine would be on the house. They won, we ran out of steam, but will never stay at this or any other Doubletree again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what an amazing stay...”
Reviews.Author: Rodvacation
Reviews.Content: I managed to swing a great price for the room via Hotwire, it was cozy plush and very romantic. My girlfriend fell in love this weekend, and I know the Doubletree had something to do with it. Thanks again for all the help from the Front Desk staff, oh and those chocolate chip cookies...all they needed was milk. The king size bed was exactly that, fit for a king & his queen. The transportation was great by using the monorail surrounding downtown Miami. What a lovely experience! Walking distance away from Bayfront was a treat as well!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience i ever had - is this place managed by anyone?”
Reviews.Author: JimBeamer
Reviews.Content: I normally do not write reviews (although i read them and use tripadvisor.com for some time now) - but my experience at the Doubletree Grand was all but grand and prompted me to finally sign up and contribute a review. Let me start with the good stuff: The Lobby is beautiful and very clean, simply put: very shiny! The views in the Bayview Rooms are simply put awesome! The Hotels seems to be just one of the businesses in the building, the building itself consists of mostly Condominiums (with plenty of dog owners i may add.) We arrived via Taxi and were friendly greeted by a Doorman opening the cab door. I think he spoke english. (?) We tried to get the attention of a Bellhop, but, oh never mind, we idd not have that much luggage anyway and made our way to the Front Desk. It was 4pm but a 2 Doublebed Hotelroom as we booked (Bayview) was not ready. We were offered to have our luggage stored, with after some waiting time was done. I may add that so far the conversation with the Front Desk people were not very pleasant, as they seem to be very annoyed and bothered by us showing up and the room not beeing ready, as if it was our fault. Anyhow, an hour later we were in our room. The room itself was clean with the exception of some hair in the bathtub... brrr! The Balcony and the Windows were very, very dirty. But we did not mean to bother anyone about that, we are usually easy going. The pool is and exterior "olympic sized" on the 10th floor and very nice. the Hotel shares it with the Condo Owners, which seem to be slightly bothered by the hotel guests, but that is understandable. It made us feel uncomfortable though. Upon reentering our room we discovered the ceiling in the bathroom leaking water and the air vent towards the bed turned into a water sprayer. To get help in this matter, an engineer to our room and responses from the Front Desk was like pulling teeth. It turned out the A/C was responsible for the water intrusion and the engineer sort of vacuumed the ceiling tiles dry. No apologies or at least sympathy was provided or shown from the Front Desk. The engineer gaves a coupon for extra cookies to be picked up at the Front Desk. Hmm, fine, we like the cookies, but it did not dry our luggage or shoes. The next morning at checkout the Front Desk did ask us how our stay was and i mentioned the A/C incident. I was asked if i reported it the evening before and why i would bring it up now at checkout. I suppose they thought i was going for a rate reduction for my stay - which i surely would have appreciated, but i was not seeking it - and were very unfriendly. The manager told us that these things happen and there is nothing they could do about it. Still no "sorry" or apology. Oh, before i actually got to talk to the manager, i had to deal with Desk Agent who were either not trained at all or did not care much for hotel operations. The only person who was engaging and friendly was "Roberto" (?) who brought us new towels after we used ours for the pool. The Front Desk however, seemed utterly confused, untrained and even the manager would propably not last long in a real business envirement, because this property seems to have very, very low standards for "managers".

Reviews.Title: “management, charges, room, service all substandard”
Reviews.Author: owleyes99
Reviews.Content: We booked a few months in advance and called a day before to confirm but when we got there they overbooked. So after nine hours of traveling to get there, we had to wait another two hours before they could find us a room in another hotel. (I think they were having a hard time finding a place for us) They paid for the taxi to the other hotel,(they tried to get us to drive but we didn't want to) and the other hotel was very nice, obviously more pricey and we thought we lucked out. Checking in at the other hotel they asked for a credit card just for other expenses like food or damages, but they said the other Doubletree would obviously cover the room but after we got home we had an extra $1000 bill, for one night!!! Our second night was back at doubletree and the room was dank and smelly. I've been in better $40 dollar rooms. We were really tired and hot, but when we turned on the ac water was coming out of it and we found a leak in the ceiling in front of the bathroom. It was a slow leak and we just wanted to sleep(we also figured they didn't have any more rooms, and they were really slow to do anything) so we told them in the morning, and they responded annoyed, "did you tell anyone last night?" No, you overbooked, so there probably wasn't another room and i didn't want workers bothering us in our room. Oh, and valet service is mandatory.

Reviews.Title: “ver good impression”
Reviews.Author: Hossam_Adel
Reviews.Content: Well, I stayed at this nice hotel for like 6 nights and it was the first time for me to try the Doubletree as I used to stay at the Hilton itself and I was a bit afraid of trying new thing, but now I can say that I made the right choice by staying at this fantastic hotel, we were 3 of us sharing same room and the room was big enough to accommodate even more. I really likes their balcony as it was really spacious and you can have the morning coffee while looking at the nice and fantastic view on the boats there cruising their way, they had a nice setting of bathroom as its divided into 2 sections which was really nice if you are 2 or even more. The best issues I experienced in this hotel was dealing with the concierge and I even remember his name â€œSergeâ€� as he was treating everyone with that personalized smile and he was always there asking if any of us needed any help, explaining things, and giving you options and recommend the best for you. Also the front office staff, as I remember that I forgot my cell phone at my room and I called the front office to let them know about it and they immediately sent someone and kept it at their safe until I returned, they even called me to confirm they has it. Last thing I really liked about this hotel, is the small shopping shops on the ground floor where we used to buy whatever we needed and we really enjoyed having the breakfast in one of the coffeeâ€™s in addition that we had a nice steak at the steak restaurant there with a friendly services. Bottom line is that whenever Iâ€™m in Miami, this will be my #1 hotel choice even though itâ€™s on the bay away from the Miami south beach actions and famous streets but it worth the distance besides this is what the taxis are made for :) Just wanted to thank all the hotel staff for the outstanding services I witnessed for me and my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Comfort and GRAND!!!”
Reviews.Author: GweeVermont
Reviews.Content: We have read all the other reviews, and just had to put in our opinion!!! We were greeted graciously and professionally and check-in was a breeze. Our room was ready for us, and we experienced no disappointment whatsoever with this hotel. We chose this location because we have stayed in Miami before, but not in this particular area of the city, and we like to move around when we travel. But we both agree that we won't shift loyalties the next time we visit Miami and will gladly book this hotel again without any hesitation. The room was neat and extremely clean, all amenities were top-notch. High end soaps and supplies. Towels thick and fluffy. Bathroom spotless. Bed and linens inviting and fantastically comfortable. View of Biscayne Bay and the park to the north of the hotel was just lovely. Concierge desk was busy but friendly and accommodating - they act as security for the condos and that is obviously their first priority - so there were understandable interruptions. There is a mall of sorts on the first two levels of the hotel (it is also connected to the Marriott via doors and to the Omni and parking garage via a skywalk across the street) . This area has several shops, restaurants, and convenient services, although we thought prices were a bit high - our Asian dinner cost $80 for two and was good, but not extraordinary. Every interaction we had with any of the hotel staff was great. Housekeepers were friendly and helpful and we noticed security officers making rounds throughout the hotel at various times - and they were also friendly and helpful. Bellmen and valets were always present, busy and efficient, and never failed to open the doors and offer assistance and friendly greetings. We walked to the tram half a block south and easily made our way around the city, although the bellmen can definitely get a cab for you in seconds. There is a great park just to the north of the hotel, lots of walkers and a great place to stretch your legs and enjoy the incredible views of Biscayne Bay. The lobby is just beautiful, as is the exterior. The rooftop pool is warm and the hot tubs are huge and incredibly clean. There are numerous tropical plants which separate the two areas, and the views from the terrace are very nice. Everything we had anything to do with was in top notch condition. Elevators were clean and quick to respond. We sailed from Port of Miami and stayed here a few days before our cruise - and we took advantage of the discounted shuttle offered by the hotel - book it the day before at the front desk and the charge is placed on your room - how easy is that? It arrived on time and the driver was very hospitable. We do have past experience working in the hospitality industry, and therefore have high expectations when we travel. We also know that sometimes you have to make exceptions when things aren't what you expect... but this was NOT the case with our experience at the DoubleTree Grand in Miami. ALL of our expectations were met or EXCEEDED. We were more than satisfied with our accommodations, the hotel staff, and the hotel facilities. We would definitely make it a point to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a NIGHTMARE.”
Reviews.Author: pathout
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and it was the most horrible experience of any hotel I've experienced. The staff cannot manage a hotel. I got there with reservations made 4 months in advance only to find that my room was not clean and ready for me to check in. I waited 2 hours to check in, and had to deal with a very rude manager and staff. Next, I was booked for a double bed room because my coworker was coming in the next day. Instead, they gave us a single bed and said there was no other room left. The room smelled like cigarettes even though it was a non smoking room. The next day after being at a conference all day, I was in need of a band aid and called for them to bring me one. Their response? No, none of us are allowed to leave the lobby. Even though there are five of us. Upon my checkout, of course, they charged us incorrectly and when we called back to resolve the issue, they were rude and unhelpful. I do not know how these people run a hotel. Hopefully, they hire someone with a brain before the place gets shut down.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL MANAGEMENT EVER”
Reviews.Author: mcm0224
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a wedding. First, I asked for early check in and when I got to the desk, our room was not available. They told us they were fully booked and we had to come back at 3 pm for our room. Then, I requested for a room near the elevator and on the same floor as some of the wedding guests. I think, out of spite, they out us in the farthest room possible from the elevator and nowhere near any of the other guests. The view outside of our room was a bush, not the ocean or even a garden, but a huge bush taking up most of the window. We called the concierge several times during the day for a shuttle, since there were about 20 of us staying there. They were very unaccommodating. In the end, some of us took a cab and one of the valets told us about a shuttile, literally 30 min before our dinner reservations. The late night concierge was rude when we came back around 1 am. Asking us why we didn't stay out later, and calling us OLD! Keep in mind that we are all in our mid twenties. Upon checkout, I received my rooming bill and figured that was the amount charged on my credit card. I looked at my account and they charged more than what was stated on the bill. I called front desk for a copy and they said there were too busy to handle it and someone would call me back later. I doubt I will get a phone call. Also on our day to check out, the front desk offered to call the valet to have our car ready for us. We got outside and our car wasn't there. Of course, they never received the phone call. Never in my life have I received such poor service from a hotel. I've been to hotels around the world, 1 to 5 stars, and this has got to be the worst hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CleveT
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many places but this, the service was exceptional you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost!! Worst Experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: Hooper191
Reviews.Content: This double tree might look nice from the pictures but after the lobby you should turn around! Staff needs some serious training especially the management! The room looked like they went to the back alley to get the furnitur and it smelled like feet. Our view was of an old abandon building, and come 7am we were woken up by construction! We tried to make the best of it, thought we'd make some coffee and what do you know the coffee pot didn't work! We called the front desk to complain of the noise and no coffee and they told us its not there fault it's the cities problem and they would send A coffee pot up, which we never got. No hospitality just rude! And don't eat at the restaraunts in the hotel way over priced and food is better at mcdonald's. Horrible experience all around and expensive. I wish we would have stayed at the days inn!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Experience I Can Remember Having”
Reviews.Author: IrritatedKat
Reviews.Content: I arrived a bit early but was given a room to check out. After walking seemingly endless hallways to the very last room at the end I viewed a beautiful room that I swore must have been in Cuba for as far as I had walked. The Desk Clerk graciously changed the room to accomodate our busy schedule and while the new roon was a bit smaller the location could not have been better. I was relocated to the 1st room left off the elevator with other associates in the 1st room right off the elevator; but that was the last good experience. I had had to put up one of my credit cards to get into the room even though another associates credit card had already been put up to pay for the room, but she would not arrive until late that evening. The clerk said "No problem, when she arrived we could switch out the credit cards (my limit was lower and I needed to funds to cover the World Conference Expenses). .After getting my luggage relocated I called to get additional towels brought to the room. There would be 4 of us and there were only 2 towels. At 9:30 that night we were still calling for towels. Every night, on returning from our busy schedule we had to call for clean towels and wait 1 to 2 hours for them to be delivered. On the third night, about 1 am there was a persistant knocking on the door that woke everyone and housekeeping attempted to deliver a roll-away bed that we had not ordered. I wonder if the people who wanted that bed ever got it. Oh, and by the way, my credit card never got cleared. We had to see the accounting department on their schedule and were told that it didn't matter that they had the credit card recorded that was going to pay for the room they were not going to release my card until we checked out. We stayed from Jan 27th and left Jan 31st. The hotel double charged my card putting me in an over-limit situation. This is now Feb 22 and they have still not corrected and released my credit card. They collected their funds on Feb 2nd, by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: pemex
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous about booking a room here for the Miami sailboat show - based on the Tripadvisor reviews. However - we had a very nice stay at this hotel. I am a 100K flyer and I see my share of hotel rooms during the year - and I can honestly say that we have a good time here - and that our room exceeded expectations. (We had a city-view double-bed room with a view of a cement wall and some bushes - I am guessing the least expensive room in the hotel - but it was very nice. Ok yeah - it was not five star and the TV stand was a bit "weathered" - but all in all a nice-enough room.) Also check-in at 1pm on a Friday during boatshow weekend was instant (no-wait) and our room was ready for check-in at that time. Also - my requested roll-away bed and bucket-of-beers (e.g. via the DoubleTree "pre-arrival" service) was delivered seamlessly - no issues. Throughout the two night stay - the front desk staff was quite courteous and professional - and the concierge as well. We had a great breakfast at Gauchitos and a nice lunch overlooking the Bay at the Bleu Moon - both are in the hotel lobby/complex. Also enjoyed cocktails at next door Marriott lounges - as well as at Mikes Bar (e.g. a real dive bar IMHO) on the 9th Floor - just down the pier. Speaking of the pier - we spotted a manatee just off the dock outside the hotel. How cool is that? Also - the Olympic size pool on the 8th floor is a real treat. A clean pool with mature plants surrounding the pool deck. I swam laps in the morning Sat/Sun and had the entire pool to myself. Pool is heated - and there is a hot tub as well. Views from the 8th floor pool deck over Biscayne Bay are spectacular. I am not sure if this is the best location to experience Miami - but it is a short cab ride to South Beach etc for dinner - and the public transportation is nearby. Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “If you like "historical" sites and adventures in the City of Miami...”
Reviews.Author: HeinBloed
Reviews.Content: I was surprised: all other hotels were booked and I could get a 350 USD-suite with two bedrooms and two bathrooms in a great location of Miami. I put a remark in my booking that I would like to have a view to the cruise terminal. But they never responded to that that it was not available. Somehow it was difficult to find as clear signposts were missed. Reception was friendly. But then... waiting for the lift you need ear muffs. Due to strong winds it was so loud. Then you can get dirty lift cars for animals... Once you arrive in your room you had the impression that the last visit was a burglar (checking the lock of the door) and not the housekeeping who forgot to place toilet paper. 1/2 roll for both bathrooms. Unfortunately they forgot to gell that the 2nd bathroom is outside the bedroom so you better have your bathrope with you if you have to transit through kitchen and living area to the bathroom. All furnitures on the balcony were rusty. Looked like they took it from Starlight Express... Rusty... When we wanted to go to bed we found out that the frame of the bed was broken! So 10.30 pm we had manager in our room, some workers who tried to fix the bed and the housekeeping to made the replacement bed and to deliver the toilet paper. The door lock was broken: every time the lift door opened the door jumped open. So they try to fix this problem also at 11.00 pm while I was jetlagged and only want to see my bed.

Reviews.Title: “Blown away...after reading reviews here”
Reviews.Author: favor4lette
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a group of friends on a last minute Superbowl road trip. I was a little worried about this hotel because of the reviews here, but I've determined that most or all of the bad reviews must have come from people staying in hotels rooms. We had a condo on the 40th floor (PC) and it was fabulous, to say the least. I was far more than ANY of us expected. Very updated furniture, surround sound in the living room, flat screen television in the all rooms. Two nice size bedroom and another room with a bed (that we didn't know we had). Two baths, one VERY spacious. Nice kitchen with modern stainless appliances, washer and dryer, and a balcony to die for!!!! It was so great that we're planning a return trip to Miami and this hotel will be our first choice. So, if you're thinking about booking here, just make sure you get a condo. The price was great also.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was awful...”
Reviews.Author: PaigersWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: I had reservations with a college friend, but our flight was cancelled due to a storm. Our friends went to the hotel. We tried to send them a bottle of champagne and strawberries since we could not be there. It was a herculean effort that invoved hours on the phone, a fax with instructions and still their gift did not arrive when it was suppossed to-- on saturday night when they checked in... I called back to the hotel room service manager to see where the item was (on sunday) since my friends told me they did not recieve it. Again, it took at least 30 minutes on the phone with little explanation of where my order even was. The room service manager told me he would call me back when he figured out what happened. I did not receive a return call Sunday, Monday or Tuesday... but did learn from my friend that the champagne was delivered to her door on Tuesday at 8 am.... It was suppossed to be there Saturday around 9PM... Who wants champagne at 8AM on the day you check out... She also told me that it took over an hour to get coffee so I suspect this is part of a larger management problem.

Reviews.Title: “Ok....In agreement that its unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: sophelia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel prior to a cruise. I've stayed at Double trees all over the US and have never had a bad experience. There were a few reviews here that made me nervous however I went through with my reservation. It was fine. The location was convenient to the ports. My spouse and I were able to make it from the airport to this hotel without calling a cab. We took the trains and got off at the Omni rail station. They offered a shuttle to the ports when we were ready and they had the yummy cookies waiting. Word of advice if you plan on visiting south beach just stay in south beach. The taxis from this hotel to south beach where all the action is was $16 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Grand Biscayne Bay - average”
Reviews.Author: TravellerforBusiness
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this Doubletree in Jan 2010. Hotel location poor. Not much nearby. Hotel itself part of an arcade containing the Marriott and 5 restaurant/cafe dining options and high-priced boutiques. Both hotel buildings contain actual residences. Most residents appear to be dog owners. Tons of little yappy dogs on leads created a lot of noise in the large somewhat grand foyer. Front desk staff unhelpful and a little clueless. Provided incorrect info a few times. Very busy with scores of families sitting/standing about waiting to check-in due to early arrival and late check-in time. But Concierge was awesome! Directed us to fantastic Garcia's Seafood. Unreal. Our hotel room was large, old, outdated with large balcony and bathroom. Bedroom doorless. Nice bay view. Room Service was quick and thoughtful. 8th floor nice and quiet. I recommend this Hotel only to folks who are not irritated by long waits and outdated decor at a relatively high price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: mtonyc
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for a long weekend after returning from a cruise and were really happy with the accomodations and service. We had a huge balcany suite with an amazing view of the bay. We had easy access to the many restaurnats and bar lounges in downtown Miami. Our only complaint was that we had to request the balcony furniture be cleaned prior to us enjoying the space. Apart from that, it was a great way to end a week long cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible. Absolute sham”
Reviews.Author: Zorangirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was awful. We stayed for 3 nights, there wasn't a shower curtain, there were poop smears on the door frame. Carpets had big black wet stains. Our tv died and the repair guy asked us to help him put a new one in. We had to ask for room service to come clean our room. the coffee table, side tables and buffet had sticky stains all over them and the hide away bed had old dirty sheets. The $30 per day valet company forgot to have my car ready. The only good thing was the free cookies

Reviews.Title: “Not a dump, but dumpy”
Reviews.Author: 328Traveller
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the location ... was hoping for places to walk to, shops to visit, restaurants nearby, etc. What I experienced was a lot of construction noise on the north side of the property and lots of local residents walking their dogs .... no local businesses or attractions within walking distance. The room was clean but had old furniture ... worn and dumpy in appearance. The award-winning Chinese restaurant, while producing good-tasting food, had slow and confused service .... poor language skills on the part of the staff exacerbated the problem. I travel for a living and look forward to seeing sights when off-duty ... not going to come to this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away, Far below the money being charged”
Reviews.Author: MCUBE
Reviews.Content: What a disaster stay! I was vacation after two years and decided to choose Double tree becuase of my experience with the St Petersburg, FL. The carpet in hallway was reeking with foul odor. The room had loose hanging wires, I had one year old with me and also broken sockets. The TV in front room was not working and when I moved in the TV in bedroom was ON. All rooms had TV remote control labeled as "Do Not Use".I never received a single USA Today newspaper through entire stay although it was advertised in the flyer given at check in. The paint through the room was fading and with lot of streaks of dark colors. At the entry one of the pantry had a worn out vacuum cleaner and bunch of other trash just thrown in there. The balcony and the furniture had thick dirt layer and seemed to be not used for years. There was no "Do Not Disturb" door tag and service would be provided even when didnt ask for one. I dont spent much time in room but having stayed in hotel rooms around the world including third world countries This property is the worst I have stayed. I feel cheated and lost my hard owned money. Apart from the first courtesy call within seconds of opening door I was not asked how pleasant my stay was not even on my way out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location & pool--hotel room just average”
Reviews.Author: mizlori
Reviews.Content: Took a taxi from MIA for about ~$30. HHonors had special expedited check-in which was nice. Greeted by cookie! YUM!!! The hotel is floors 6-9 and not in the most appealing condition. Floors above that are condos. Take advantage of the upgrade offers you get when reserving online; when you check in they are no longer an option at that price, which I unfortunately learned. Wish I would've gotten the 2 bedroom condo for just $40 more than our hotel room but since I didn't check that option online, they wouldn't honor it upon check-in. Lobby is very nice. One inside area entrance for hotel rooms, separate entrance for owners and condo units. Low, old basement-like square block ceilings in dingy hallways to the hotel rooms. The 2 double-bedded room we had was large and faced the bay. Windows were very dirty, balcony and its furniture well worn. Interior of room was nice though; nice couch, good beds, distressed-style furniture. Bathroom a typical bathroom at a hotel. In room coffee-maker though they need to supply more creamers. I put in an online ahead-of-time order for extra towels and coffee, but these items were not in the room upon check-in. Pool area is awesome; clover-shaped hot tub clusterâ€”4 of them. VERY nice. Nice restaurants and some small shops on the ground level of hotel complex. We ate at Primoâ€™s which was excellent. Picked up some breakfast items and wine at the little deli-style store too.

Reviews.Title: “Had four days of meetings here. What a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: stubbs1970
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent venue for business meetings. We had four days of meetings using a couple of the meeting rooms, and everyone was very well pleased. We cannot compliment the sales and banquet staff enough. All of needs were taken care of in a timely fashion, and the food service was about as good as we have seen for this type of function. Rooms were very comfortable. Some of the fixtures and furnishings in mine were a little worn, but the view from the "Bayview" room was worth it. Primo's restaurant downstairs is also worth a visit for at least one evening. Hotel guests are the use of a private health club in lieu of a fitness room. Pretty good setup.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: BtownBell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-situated, about a 10 minute drive to South Beach across the MacArthur Causeway, 5 minutes to Bayside shopping center, 20 minutes to the airport car rental offices. It's on Biscayne Bay next to a Marina in a building that has 3 floors of hotel and the rest condos. It has a great pool deck with lots of lounge chairs and a four-leaf clover-shaped hot-tub (basically 4 different connected tubs). There is a great view from the pool deck, although you can't see it while you're swimming. The only form of parking is valet, but this worked out fine and eliminated parking hassles. The valets, check-in staff, and concierge were friendly and helpful. Free USA Today every morning except weekends. There is a high-end convenience store/deli downstairs as well as a newspaper stand that is open late. The room itself was OK. The air conditioning is loud and blanket, though snuggly, was too warm. They brought us a lighter one the second night. The maid service did not get rid of anything (empty bottles, newspapers on the floor, etc) that was not in the wastepaper bins. They had the usual system of towels: if you hang it up, supposedly the maids will leave it for you to use again -- but they didn't. They took all the used towels away. A couple times they didn't replace all the towels and we had to call down to get additional ones. Also, you have to bring your hotel towel to use at the pool. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the DoubleTree Grand.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand made my 4 days of work in Miami relaxing and stress-free”
Reviews.Author: 29Teddy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand for 4 days on business. I got an excellent deal on a bayfront room and then got upgraded to a suite (must be all those Doubletree points I accumulated) with 2 balconies. The view of Biscayne Bay is spectacular especially at night when Miami Beach and the cruise ships are lit up. The rooms are clean and the linens are good quality. The first room I was given had a mushy bed but when I complained the next bed was just right. The pool is huge, and sparkling clean. The gym is well-appointed and not crowded. This is not a glitzy, newly decorated hotel and is a tad worn, but unless you require that sort of thing the Grand is luxurious enough. Although there were weddings and other events at the hotel when I was there, my room was very quiet and there was no noise through the walls or from the unit above me. Valet parking was $29 a night but it is the city after all - and the room was so discounted to begin with it was still a great deal. Most of the Grand is devoted to condos and the complex is like a self-contained little city with restaurants (some excellent ones actually), medical clinic, dentist, a little supermarket, liquior store and other shopping. There is a monorail stop next door. There are condos available for rent for those on longer stays or who need more room. If you are devoted to the beach, this hotel may not be the best choice - but if you don't need oceanfront to be happy, I think this is an excellent choice. Oh, and the staff couldn't have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: metsjerseygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a mini vacation. I rented a privately owned condo , which was absolutely amazing! it had 3 bedrooms kitchen and wonderful view. I will definitely stay here when returning to the Miami area. Day staff was friendly, but night staff was not very accommodating. Also, be prepared to hear lots of dogs barking in the middle of the night (other residents have pets). It does not really bother me, but I'm sure it must get annoying to others. Construction (long term) in the area also was a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel awesome location”
Reviews.Author: favargas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in twice, once in a junior suite; Very good size suite, (and I was able to get it using a point streecher - For HHonnors members : I have not seen another hotel that offers this in the Miami area, the only drawback is the breakfast, muffin and orange juice worst than a Hampton Inn) Evrything was very nice!!! My second stay was in a 2 bedroom, 2 Bath penthouse which was great too!!! it was huge!!! the furniture was rather new, breath taking views of the biscayne bay. It is located near good restaurants shopping areas and night clubs. The staff was mostly friendly (Valet was the exception, they will make you wait forever for your car!!!) The pool and the inside of the building was very nice (although they had cameras everywhere that looked out of a 1980' s movie; by the way this hotel was featured in a movie from around that time - don't know the name though) Great value not 5 star but is good.

Reviews.Title: “not so much”
Reviews.Author: beatricepugzilla
Reviews.Content: Come to MIA for business at least once a month and usually stay at other Hilton properties but booked this hotel since colleagues were staying at the Doubletree. I should have known there would be problems when the hotel only cost $99 a night. The room that was given to me had a great view of the bay however the sliding glass door would not lock, the carpets literally had old food on them, the bed had actual dirt on the sheets and the bathroom was filthy. Went to the front desk and after an hour was given another room - at least the second room had clean sheets and carpets - the bathroom, still dirty. Since it was late, I did not change hotels but got up early, went to a gym in the area and showered there. Would not stay here again. The hotel is old, needs a good cleaning and a renovation. there are too many hotels in the area to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view...great room”
Reviews.Author: TDmize
Reviews.Content: We got a 2 bedroom condo for 3 nights back in March. When arriving to the room, it was 2 bedroom as described, plus another small bedroom. Amazing view, kitchen area and washer/dryer. The furniture was a little dated, but the beds were comfortable. Location of the hotel was great for a short cab ride to south beach. Restaurants/shops are located on the lobby level of the hotel, fair warning....they are quite pricey, but close and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: GT6
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night, May 6th, while on business. The lobby and restaurant areas are very nice and nicely updated. But, that is where anything good ended for this hotel. The hallway was dimly light and the carpets were stained throughout the entire hallway. The hallway was very warm as well. My room was spacious and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was dirty and the carpets in the room were stained as well. The airconditioner couldn't get the room below 71, no matter where I set the thermostat. Outside of the lobby, this was nothing more than a tired hotel. I gave it a 3 out of 5 because the lobby was so nice and the staff were nice as well. Otherwise, it would have been a 2 out of 5. Also, valet parking is $30 per night. There are a lot of better options in the area. I would try one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, spacious, not really clean”
Reviews.Author: MSkinner
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night (pre-cruise) at the hotel, in one of the privately-owned condos. It's a massive building - I couldn't tell you how many rooms there were. But ours was very spacious, decent amenities, huge balcony with a great view, but just a little worn. And dirty. Feet sticking to the floor kind of dirty. As we were there just the 1 night, didn't get a chance to use the pool, hot tub, etc but they looked pretty good, as did the lobby bar / restaurant. It was very close to the port for our cruise - just a couple minute taxi ride. But for cruisers who wish to stock up on things before getting on board, the nearest decent store was a Walgreen's a couple miles away. There was a small store in the building, but just ridiculous prices. Our only issue with the location was that you didn't exactly feel real 'safe' in the area. It was nothing you could specifically identify - just a feeling. Overall, though, it was a pretty good value. 6 of us stayed in the condo, with a kitchen, etc instead of 2 or 3 regular hotel rooms. Would we go back? It'd be 50/50. Very likely, we'd try another location.

Reviews.Title: “If not for business...would be unhappy !!”
Reviews.Author: sandibeach
Reviews.Content: Well, Here on business so not worried about a lot of extras.. 1. Not close to beach... 2. $ 9.00 for internet a night...what? Motel six has free internet.. 3. $25.00 to park 4. No cont. Breakfast Maybe just picky, but could and have done better on business and if for pleasure would not consider... Was clean and I did feel safe...About 15-20 minutes to SBeach rest.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay- Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: luischable
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks like it needs a complete makeover. The corridors are worn and the hotel has a sad feel about it. Not dirty just worn. Rooms are clean and functional nothing elaborate. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite which had a seperate annex for the Bed. Strangely there was only a wardrobe but nowhere to put socks etc Although we were on the 9th floor- which is the highest floor for the hotel proper we heard alot of road and delivery traffic. The piece that is really disappointing is the Breakfast. You receive a voucher for $7 which can be used at one of two places in the Shopping Mall. It is impossible to eat for this price and often works out more expensive than if you ate somewhere else. Parking at $29 is also excessive. There is nothing much in the vicinity of the hotel so you really need a car if you want to go to South Beach. Pool area is smaller than I had been led to believe from other reviews. Fine for a day or two but not a resort. For one night before a Cruise this hotel would be fine at the right price but there are much nicer hotels to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice, but in poor condition”
Reviews.Author: NomadicBeth
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my family for one night. I am a Hilton Gold member, so I have stayed at many Doubletrees and other Hilton family chains, and have always been pleased. This was one of the worst hotel stays. The quality of the hotel itself is nice, but the maintenance is not. During our stay we encountered these problems: Wireless Internet did not work Elevators were broken. I got stuck in one for 5 minutes. At other times we could not get the elevator from our floor, and had to walk part of the way down to get an elevator from another floor because the stairs did not go all the way down. We never received a bill under our door for express check out. Half of the outlets in the room did not work The lights would turn on and off if you moved slightly in the bed, so the only way to get stable lighting was to open the curtains during the day. The coffee pot in the room was broken, and someone in our party got burned. The business center is not connected to the hotel, so you cannot charge things from the business center to your room. We requested a rollaway, first they brought a crib, then brought the actual bed. It was the most uncomfortable bed, it made a V shape. We took the mattress off the bed and put it on the floor. I spoke to 3 different people at the hotel about this problem, but they did not seem to care that much. I would not stay at this hotel again. However, it was clean and I always felt safe there (except for when stuck in the elevator)

Reviews.Title: “It's Grand at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: jimmyboy2
Reviews.Content: THE GRAND was big and BEAUTIFUL ,Its like a small city,four ,restaurants,shops,drug and liquor stores etc, don't need a car everything is a short cab ride or short walk ,South Beach or art district . stayed in a large one bedroom condo new kitchen ,living and dining room. The views from the large terrace were of the bay and city ,our condo 3244 was outstanding the staff was great,We are making plans to stay in the same unit feb. I recommend the slightly higher price of the condo it was big and beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Good but Different Stay”
Reviews.Author: pr123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Miami for personal business and booked the Double Tree because it was it great rate on Hilton's website. When we arrived I asked if an upgrade was available, and received a 1 bedroom suite in the residential condo building. Lots of space, great view! The suite was obviously someone's 1 bedroom condo as the furnishings were unusual; and the tv was hard to figure out, but this was more than made up for by the size and comfort. Check in staff were very helpful, and when we needed help with the tv it came quickly. The hotel is connected to a shopping arcade with an interesting collection of shops & a few restaurants. One of the restaurants acts as the hotel's breakfast restaurant. Overall, it was certainly not what we expected and might not be for everyone (ie. if you are used to a "standard" business hotel), but was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay with Some Minor Problems”
Reviews.Author: caneshockey31
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Biscayne Bay is convenintely located off of Route 1 (Biscayne Blvd.) It is basically connected to the Marriott Biscayne Bay. The hotel is not just a hotel but a big residental skyrise. It seems that every person that lives here has a dog or two, so there are always dog walking around the lobby and restaurant areas. I even noticed an owner walking the dog out the back lobby and the dog was peeing on the building. Upon arriving at the hotel, my reservation was for a King Bay View Room with a balcony, upon checking in i was given a Standard King with a supposed no balcony. I inquired about why this was (even with my Diamond Status, i was bumped per say from my room that i had made a reservation for and was merely told that we were sold out this weekend) Upon arriving at Room 949, my room did have a balcony, though stating on the sliding door" For your safety and security this door will not open" All i had to do was pull the lock up and bam the door slid open and i had access to a balcony. Though the balcony was shared with three other rooms next to me and there were no dividers (beware) Breakfast coupons were given to me and were good for (up to $8) which i used each morning at the deli for eggs and bacon or french toast. Great views and lots of places to walk around and exercise. I did use the 10th floor pool, this pool was heated and between (85 to 90 degrees) very comfortable no matter what time of day or wind condition. Very clean area and not busy during the times that i went. The hotub is a big hottub with 4 coves (if you will) that allow you to mix and mingle if you wish. Cesar (Head Concierge) was great during my whole stay. Cons: Housekeeping was awful (one day i got no towels, one day i got one towel and the other day i got two towels) One of the days i left the room at 8am to go to my conference upon returing around 3:30 p.m. the room had still not been touched as was never done during the whole day. Front staff was medicore at best, though the hotel was fully booked for Nascar and various other events. The hotel was not apologetic with the room mixup and was blaming the Diamond Desk for a rate code problem. If i did return i would stay in one of the condos not in the hotel part. Valet parking was a joke, $29 dollars a day (though you do have in and out privilages)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location and Valet Service”
Reviews.Author: McCarran226
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury hotel, but it is conveniently located 2 blocks from the Venetian Causeway that takes you over to South Beach and 5 minutes from downtown Miami and the major freeways. Rooms were comfortable, spacious and quiet. Hotel is right on the bay. Pool and hot tub area above average, but not over the top. The downside is that the Doubletree merely leases a few floors from The Grand condominium, so you are staying in a mixed use building with a lot of hotel and condominium traffic. Valet service took great care of our vehicle during our 4-night stay at $1 tip each time we picked up and dropped off our vehicle. Great for families and visitors to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Double Tree Not so Grand”
Reviews.Author: Kimmy24
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Upon entrance of the hotel, it is beautiful inside, the lobby that is. Staff are okay. The concerge desk is unfriendly and rude when asked time taken on the way back to get to airport via taxi. Very standoffish. I stayed in the 1 bedroom condo. Upon 'glance' appearance, it is very nice looking. Many spots on the ceiling from water damage and oil spots. Bed was comfortable. Shower disguistingly dirty with mold apparent. Soaker tub was not clean as hairs found. I was woken up via phone by the housekeeping staff asking what time I would be checking out. Then an hour later the staff knocked on the door and asked again when I would be checking out. Quite the disturbance. The pool is dirty with brown stains on the bottom. I would not walk about bare foot around the pool as it also looked unkempt. This hotel is a sad attempt at renovating a very old building. I would rather pay the same expensive rate and get my moneys worth elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Having to switch rooms in the middle of the night is never good”
Reviews.Author: wwwstudyofmakeupcom
Reviews.Content: I was booked at the Doubletree Grand Hotel Biscayne Bay for a business trip to Miami. Here's the lowdow: The Upside: Sunny pool with enough space to accomodate a crowd. Quick drive across the bay to South Beach. Doubletree cookies at check in. Le Faubourg Deli downstairs has a great selection . Bay view is great. Walking distance to two other big hotels, shops, restaurants. The Downside: The non-smoking rooms on the 6th floor still reek of smoke. The rooms need to be rescued from the 1980's. The closet had a leak from the bathroom. THE SHEETS WERE DIRTY. The reception area is too small for a hotel that size. The balcony on the 6th and 9th floor cannot be accessed. The no-pets policy had recently been implemented because of a problem with fleas. This hotel is in need of an overhaul. I moved rooms in the middle of the night because I discovered that the sheets weren't clean when I finally made it to bed after a long work day. The manager came up to the 6th floor with keys to a suite (non-smoking) that still reeked of smoke. I was then given a suite on the 9th floor with a great bay view but because of insurance limitations, the balcony's sliding doors could not be opened. I would wait until the hotel is renovated before booking here.

Reviews.Title: “No Customer Service, No Caring, No Management”
Reviews.Author: CruiseTraveler2
Reviews.Content: We had a miserable experience there. Arrived at 2pm, told our room was not ready. No problem, check in is at 3pm. Went downtown for some site seeing and snacks. Came back to hotel at 4:30, where they told us a college football team had not left their rooms yet, and we could not check in. After constant checking, didn't get a room until 7pm, and settled for something other than what we had reserved. Asked to have luggage brought up. Waited another hour, no luggage. Finally went downstairs to bellmans closet, and hauled my own luggage upstairs. At 9am the next morning, housekeeping knocked at the door, asking to clean the room. More insult to injury. This was a nightmare from the start. Many other guests had similar issues. Management was nowhere to be found, and a complaint letter to the hotel was never answered. I would recommend avoiding this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Planning my next visit!”
Reviews.Author: ATLMediaChick
Reviews.Content: This hotel makes my top ten list...easy! Wonderful ammenities, professional and non-evasive staff, beautiful & spacious rooms and much more. If you have the extra funds, upgrade to a jr. suite. It's so worth it! I actually had a partial view of the Bay, but it was still beautiful and I loved every bit of it! I had my heart set on staying in South Beach, but I had a budget and really couldn't take the risk of staying in a jacked up hotel in my efforts of saving a few bucks and being on the beach. I'm so happy I choose the Doubletree...you just can't go wrong! It took me less than 10 minutes to get to South Beach and less than 5 to get to Downtown clubs and restuarants. Now for the drawbacks- the daily valet fee is expensive. Be prepared for this because there is no airport shuttle and you'll probably need a car to get to South Beach. No free continental breakfast...but if you need a good cheap breakfast, there's a Denny's about 5 minutes away...shhh. lol The bar downstairs was really cool...get the mojito! In a nutshell, I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone. If you're a little leary of some of the hotels on the beach, stay here and soak up the essence of Miami. I felt like I was staying in a condo, versus a hotel. I can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great pool!”
Reviews.Author: peanutbusterparfait
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, bottom 9 or so floors are hotel, upper floors are condo dwellers. The pool was the highlight for me, big enough for lap swimming! on a rooftop, with a view to the bay. The OMNI is close by ( couple block walk) hop on that for free, get off at Freedom Tower Station and you're only a couple blocks from the Bayside Marketplace. Lovely hotel room with a great view of Biscayne Bay, nice living room, separate bedroom area...very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Really Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: chucklicht
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a weekend to celebrate a birthday and two friends joined us to participate in the celebration. I used Hilton HHonors for the first night and then booked a room for the second night. Both the Doubletree Reservation Confirmations listed a double, city view, non-smoking room with additional charges listed as: Parking Charges: Self parking 0.00 Valet parking 29.00 I have no problem with walking from a parking lot so we decided to self park. We drove to the front entrance, unloaded our two bags and I asked the attendant where the self parking lot was located. He stated that all parking MUST be valet at $29.00 per day. Showing him the confirmation listing self parking at 0.00 did nothing. So I surrendered the car keys and went to registration. As we registed I asked about the parking and why my confirmation listed free self-parking. Neither of the room clerks could explain - only saying that there is no free parking. When we arrived to our room, I called the Doubletree main reservation number to ask about the parking. They informed me that I had to speak to the local manager. So I called the hotel with my mobile phone and asked for the manager's office. I was transferred to voice mail where I left a detailed message about my question of the parking and a request he return my call. To date I have heard nothing. We were assigned room 967 - a pleasant, well furnished room with a stunning view of the J.W. Marriott Hotel next door. According to the evacuation map on the room door, our room was designated a "garden view" room while the city view rooms are located on the opposite side of the building. So, there were two initial problems; a misunderstanding about parking fees and a room which had a view different from what I booked. During the first half hour in the room we discovered an extraordinary number of other problems: 1. The light over the desk was burned out. 2. The light over the bathroom sink was burned out. 3. The light in the closet was burned out. 4. The ironing board rack in the closet was empty. 5. The hair drier in the bathroom had been removed leaving the plastic sinker-filled holes. 6. The clock-radio wasn't functioning. 7. The light switch for the bathroom lights had an internal problem causing the lights to stay on, occasionally, when the switch was turned off. Doubletree has a help desk reached by dialing "55" which I called each time we found a problem. It got to be funny as the help desk person and I started to call each other by our first names. To their credit, each problem was addressed and corrected as well as possible late on a Friday afternoon, but in a hotel of this caliber, the problems shouldn't have existed when I checked in. Then our friends checked in. They had booked two nights using only points and were assigned room 934. We visited them in their junior suite for which they paid the same number of points as I did. They had a large sitting area and an expansive terrace over looking the bay. On our way to dinner I stopped by the front desk to inquire about our room not being the city-view we had been confirmed for. They stated that despite what their own floorplan says, we had a city view. When asked about why we had a small, viewless room while our friends, for the same "price" had a spacious room with a view - they had no explanation. We had a pleasant sleep in the well air-conditioned room with really superb beds and down pillows. The next day we were out touring until 4:00. We arrived back to shower and nap until 6:30 when we had a cocktail date. The room hadn't been cleaned. I called the "55" help desk and was told that it would serviced as soon as possible. I explained that we needed the room until 6:30 and could we just have clean towels and the room cleaned after 6:30. This, I was assured, would be no problem. We met our friends for drinks and they too had not been cleaned. They asked the cleaning person in the hall who said she had too many rooms to clean and couldn't get to them all!!! At 11:00, we arrived back from dinner and the room hadn't been touched. I called "55" and got an apology - that was the best they could do. Finally, on Sunday, before checking out, I called the front desk, got the front desk manager and explained my dissatisfactions. They reduced the room rate by half - $47.99.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied. Worth more than the $.”
Reviews.Author: sgtjpl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night prior to leaving for our cruise. It was very reasonable. The services, decor, furnishings, cleanliness and staff were above our expectations. This is a top notch hotel We would definitely stay here again. My husband thought it was super also. View was beautiful. The only negative comment we have is that they charge for a one hour late check out. I give it a "5" for fantastic! Lisa from Georgia

Reviews.Title: “Be fussy when booking the condos”
Reviews.Author: LiamFitzP
Reviews.Content: Encouraged by the reviews on this site we booked a condo at the last minute with this hotel. From the start everything seemed to go wrong. Initiatly we were shown to a lovely condo - sadly it had the wrong number of beds so we had to move. It took well over an hour for this move to be organised - we now suspect that this was because they were trying to knock an unused room into shape. The room we finally received was poorly maintained - cupboards had broken lamps hidden in them, fittings were missing from walls, the laminate floor had chips missing from them, the windows showed signs of damp penetration and there were broken chairs on the terrace. Bedroom doors didn't shut (nor did the blinds) and the single beds (which we didn't want) were actually broken. The cleaning wasn't much better - the last occupant clearly had long black hair - it was all over the shower and the wash basins. The surfaces were covered in dust and many of the sufaces in the kitchenette were soiled. The floor clearly hadn't been swept for some time. Complaining took considerable effort - the Condo manager went out of her way to avoid us and only spoke when we insisted on seeing her. She promised to attend to all the cleaning issues and mentioned that they were planning not to let the apartment again (you can imagine how good that made us feel). She made a vague offer to move our apartments which we didn't take up as were were going out for the day and were only staying a second night. When we returned the condo showed little sign of cleaning (apart from left over containers). When we complained again and asked to see the manager we had a delegation of four staff (including the condo manager) who tried to tell us that we'd been offered a specific ocean-view apartment when we'd coplained earlier. The outcome was that that they waived the costs of one of our two nights stay and gave us free breakfast. If you are considering this hotel be aware that the condos are in a separate area and you should be ready to insist on getting a good room - the condos are not owned by the hotel but sub-let from individual owners. These owners maintain their condos to different standards so be ready to ask for a better room if you don't like the one you are given.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view!”
Reviews.Author: Jer29_11-14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree Grand Hotel on Biscayne Bay for 2 nights in May before leaving for our Caribbean cruise and we were very happy with the accomodations. Miami is a pretty pricey place to stay and for the money, I don't think you can beat the Doubletree.
