The staff was very friendly and helpful, our room was nice and clean and had a great view of Biscayne Bay (and at night, the lights of Miami Beach). It was a short taxi ride to the cruise ship and you can take the free metro train all over the city so you don't need to rent a car. Since we had never been to Miami before we wanted to see as much of it as we could, so our concierge helped us book a great trip to the Everglades, a cruise around the harbor and Star Island and a tour of Miami Beach, Coral Gables, Little Havana and Coconut Grove - all in one day!!! The restaurants at the hotel serve delicious food so you don't have to go anywhere else for meals if you don't want to. We ate dinner at Primo's twice and breakfast at the steak house - all excellent. We would definitely stay at the Doubletree on Biscayne Bay again if we ever go back to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was horrible”
Reviews.Author: Bluebelle86
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation 10 months in advance requesting a Double Non Smoking, but when I checked in I received a King bed. The staff argued with me for 1/2 an hour and finally decided to offer me a $10 breakfast voucher.They did switch me to 2 beds for the remaining of my stay (4 nights). The Conciegre(Ladies) were very rude and did'nt want to be bothered with any questions. Their facial expressions were nasty as you approched the desk. There was a plumbing problem in the bathroom. The Engineer can to fix it and used all of our towels,he stated he'll bring us towels, but we never saw him again. I did receive a call from him asking was everything fine, but still had o request towels from housekeeping. There is no Balcony to these rooms that you can go out and sit. You can only look out the window. You can not open the glass doors. There were Piegons having relations and making noises all during the morning.The valet staff were terrible. There were 2 stolen cars during my stay and they were not knowlegable of who checked what car in. I will never stay at this hotel again in my life. I will suggest the Marriott Biscayne Bay. It is Great !!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Not great.”
Reviews.Author: steveaggie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel on business for 3 nights. I booked via hilton.com and asked for an upper level room with a view of the bay. I was impressed that they gave me a room on the end facing the bay and was on the top floor. Great location! The hotel itself is a little run down as seems to be everything in Miami. The room was decent and pretty clean but not excellent. I felt that the housekeeping staff was somewhat below average. They never replaced all of my towels and I kept finding nasty long curly black hairs after they cleaned. They never got cleaned up. My other complaint is about the valet. Not only is it expensive at $29 per day but the attendants seemed a little sleazy. The hotel shares the building with what I presume are condos. The valet people seem to be indifferent to hotel patrons. The first time I left a few quarters in the drink holder. When I got the car back some of them were missing. I thought that was crappy so I made sure I didn't leave anything of value in the car after that. Good things: the bed was clean and comfortable. The front desk was very friendly and I always got my wakeup call on time. I would give it a 3 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Beware of Valet”
Reviews.Author: travelerPA99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a wedding and found the hotel to be quite nice. The rooms seemed to be recently remodeled and the staff was nice. The parking was only valet service and a bit expensive. Beware! Do not leave anything in the cars because we had some change from the tolls taken. The pool area was a nice place to relax, and there were several restaurant options in the same building. Overall, a nice stay with the exception of the trouble with the valet.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel to be discovered”
Reviews.Author: buho66
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at this hotel can only be described as great...the efficient staff and the warm welcome we received at check-in were harbingers of a fantastic extended family week-end in Miami. Certain floors (condo suites) in the hotel are under going renovation...but the work was almost unnoticeable..and very quiet....In fact, this is a very quiet hotel!! The breathtaking views and condo-suite amenities contributed to my family's protestations to stay a few more days. I call the Doubletree Grand on Biscayne...a hidden jewel in Miami for those who demand quality, but at affordable prices!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barbee524
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one night pre-cruise with my 3 sisters. We had 2 rooms which both overlooked the bay. It was nice to be able to see the cruise ships in the morning. The rooms were clean and well maintained. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck for rooms, but kudos to staff”
Reviews.Author: cherole
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great location for a short pre-cruise stay. And I have to say that the staff was excellent, as were were especially high maintenance dealing with lost baggage isues. However, the rooms themselves were awful - just drab, worn, weather beaten looking furniture. It's in an dire need of a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bayview rooms and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: BSA126
Reviews.Content: DoubleTree Grand Hotel is located in part of a condo building called The Grand. Its location is good if you have a car. Our stay was near New Years; however it was not too busy. We booked a Baywiew standard room (room 754) at a unbelievably pricey rate for 303 per night (and it was non refundable...). This is probably because it was New Years. We had to valet park at the DoubleTree at a rate of 29 dollars per day, which is actually a good deal (you're probably thinking that is overpriced), because places at South Beach, even public parking, cost 20 bucks with no in or out privileges. The only problem with valet was that they were a little slow, and that they mixed up our key (more info on that later on the review). The hotel lobby is to the left when you enter the entrance. The desk that you see in front is the condo front desk, and not DoubleTree's. Check in was swift, and three cookies were given to us. Only complaint was that the cookies weren't really warm (unlike DoubleTree Monvrovia) like advertised. Another slight complaint was the hallways leading to the hotel rooms. The chandeliers were of in the style of the 80's (not what DoubleTree usually is), and the carpets were a little faded. Also, the lighting was flouresent, which gave a spooky feel to the hallways, and not the warm feel like DoubleTree offers. However, this all changed when we entered our room, which did not look at all like most of the travelers photos. Our room was very modern (unlike the awful hallway), and gigantic! Bayview rooms are much bigger than a regular room...in which we found out later. The rooms looked pretty much like the hotel photos, just a little smaller and a different layout. Our room could probably sleep 6 if configured well. There were two comfy Sweet Dreams Bed, a work desk, a giant down sofa (which could sleep a kid if you wanted to....), and a sofa with legrest (and if you pulled up the work chair to the sofa, it could sleep a teen). There was also Neutrogena toiletries (lotion, shampoo, etc), as well as a face cleanser and a mini tube of sunscreen. In addition, our room had a Wolfgang Puck coffee maker (two single cup style) with complimentary tea and coffee. Our really big complaint with this hotel was some of the people who were at this hotel (probably the condo people). While we were at the pool, a condo owner person spit gum at us, which was simply disrespectful! No ethics at all. Also, the condo area which is with the hotel seems to be a low end condo. The elevators were so so, and inside the condo area was also like DoubleTree's hallways, but worse. Only plus about the condo area was an atrium, which was cool. The pool was pretty large, and was as deep as 6 feet near the bay side and 3 feet toward the jacuzzi. The pool area also had a view of the Marriott Biscayne Bay and cruise ships. This was a plus because you could see the cruise ships that were arriving and departing. One tip that I could see one guest using is that you can get complimentary Zephyrhills Spring Water and as many cookies as you would like just by asking the front desk. This could save you some money by not needing to waste extra money on water. Another tip is to tip the housekeeping people, unless you want a room that is 90% cleaned up (which means your pillows and linens are not placed back correctly if you moved them to a sofa, and that your face cleaner and sunscreen tube is missing). Also, sometimes towels come later on the day...like 3 PM, so if you come back at noon and don Check out was slightly slower, but still okay. Then, there came the valet problem. The valet accidentally mixed up our rental keys with the giant amount of other keys that they have. However, after 20 minutes of us searching with them, a person found our keys (which is actually a "big task" due to the fact there were more than 60 keys that the valet had). After that, we were okay. So, in conclusion, above average stay. I would have rated it excellent only if some of the condo people were not so disrespectful and had no ethics (but what can guests do about this?), if we had no problems with valet, and that the hallways were updated. Also, if they had put a dispenser of ice water, like the Marriott next door did, in their lobby, it would be a plus because Miami is very warm.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: gpptraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience at the Doubletree. We booked a 2 bedroom Condo, it was an bayview, with 2 balconies. It was very modern and large, as we have 3 teenagers. The kitchen had granite countertops and new stainless steel appliances, very nice. Two and a half baths, very large, marble, double sinks, huge shower. The master bedroom had an enormous walk in closet/dressing area with beautiful dark wood built in appointments. There were 3 flat screen TVs. My only criticism would be we had to wait about 5 hours with numerous requests to the front desk for a rollaway bed. The Condo was painted in nice colors, but poorly done. Lots and lots of comfortable space for a large family to spread out it. Convienient to walk to several restuarants close by, the doubletree is physically attached to the Biscayne Bay Marriott. This is a very close hotel to the Port of Miami if you are pre or post cruise, you can see the ships if you have a waterview room.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, great location, great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: katieloumatt93
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay prior to a cruise from Miami. We arrived after a 14hr day with flights from England. Our luggage didn't arrive at Miami as very tight connections. However, hotel lobby staf f dealt with this for us and kept our bags secure until we requested them the following morning. Hotel superb, we had a bay view room on th 9th floor with stunning views (despite the appalling weather!!) over the bay. Room huge with 2 very comfy beds. Beware of mini bar, as usual very pricey!! Staff were superb, very accommodating and helpful. The guy on the concierge even got us a complimenary limo to an italian at south beach!! All in all a fabulous hotel in a great location for a good price (Â£194 for 2 nights).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: CDY
Reviews.Content: First I need to state being a Marriott Gold member I have been upgraded to waterfront rooms in each of my stays, great views of the intracoastal. Not sure what my thoughts would be if I was given a room overlooking the construction of the condo being built next door. That being said, the rooms are large, rooms are not new however so there is some wear and tear. Front desk staff not the friendliest, they are oK but nothing special, typical of Miami. Had one issue with a phone charge, Manager never called me back. Parking is $24 per day, it is a pretty effiecent operation however. Great resturaunt on first floor not associated with hotel, it is a small Italian place and is on your right as you come in the front door excellent drink prices and decent cheap food. Hotel is a part of the Grand Condo complex, lots of traffic coming in and out. I guess the value of this hotel depends on the price you pay and the room you get. I have paid $149/night the three times I was there. At that price I consider it a good deal, but if there rates go up to $200/night during the busy season you will probably be disappointed in the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: villafatima
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights and found the Hotel excellent in all respect. Would recommend anyone who would like to stay at this hotel. I read the previous reviews on this hotel and regret they are all wrong reviews and false propaganda. I found the Hotel excellent and the staff provided me good service during my stay. The hotel is also well centrally situated in Maimi.

Reviews.Title: “when in miami....”
Reviews.Author: beachloverok
Reviews.Content: We had reservations at this hotel for a 4 night stay. We had reserved a doubles room on a non-smoking floor but when we arrived all they had was a King. They had a double bed room available, but only on a smoking floor. Normally, I wouldn't complain, however, the moment we got off the elevator, the air reeked horribly of stale smoke, enough so that our hair and clothes were instantly permeated with it. I called the front desk and stated the room was unbearable; we needed another room as soon as one became open. I think I called enough that they eventually tired of me and mysteriously 'found' another room. Once we were in that room, all was fine. The hotel overlooks the bay, very nice, and the concierge was quite helpful. It's very close to the Biscayne Bay open shopping area with great open air restuarants and stores. It's also close to the cruiselines, but if you're looking for a beach hotel, this is a 4 mile trek by vehicle only, over the bridge. Overall summary, be sure to get a nonsmoking floor, the smoking floors are the worst in any hotel I've been in, other than that, the hotel is nice.

Reviews.Title: “No problems, just a great room”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: I travel over 50% of the time on business, so I have seen a lot of hotel. I booked a junior suite on a Sunday night for one night in August 2007. It was excellent, with a great view of the marina and Miami Beach area. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the room was clean and spacious. The room was a distance down the hall, but not a far as some hotels. I heard no construction. Service was excellent, check in and out a breeze and valet service was quick. The only complaint I had was they have no restaurant of their own and you have to go to one in the nearby mall for breakfast. But my experience was great and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Try another hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Sandokan62
Reviews.Content: They have huge staff problems there, check-in takes ages, room-service: no go, and if you have booked the Standard Rooms on Levels 2 to 9 (left site elevators from Lobby) then good luck! there is a huge construction going on just opposite of the hotel. If you want to be there. Just try another hotel

Reviews.Title: “For under $150 a good place...”
Reviews.Author: MichaelChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed here (2 nights) with my family (myself, wife, and 2 older teenagers) on our way back from a week at the Ritz Carlton St. Thomas. We were originally booked at the Marriott (next door/connected) but they messed up our reservation and suggested we stayed next door at The Grand. To start off the Doubletree Grand is a 'condo - hotel;' meaning that the lower floors of the building is the Doubletree and the upper floors are condos. There is one lobby which splits into 2 elevator banks (one for hotel and one for condo). The general loby is dated with 1980 style brass and pastic-glass lighting. The Front desk for the doubletree is more modern, the staff was most helpful for our last minuet stay. We had a few room options, finding it repulsive to see a kitchen durning our stay we booked the junior suite with 1 king and 1 sofa bed. Not frequenters of Mid-Grade hotels, we were pleasntly suprised. The room was a nice size and the decor was fresh and stylish. Linens were a bit rough by our standards but for the price what do you expect. Balcony was a nice size and a partial view of the bay. Called for additional pillows and a turndown of the room and they responded promptly, including placing cookies on the pillow...intersting touch. Primary reason for staying here was proximatey to the highway, becuase we already enjoyed the relaxation of St. Thomas my wife and daughter wanted to shop. Very close to high-end shopping centers. Pool area was very dated and they didnt provide any pool service or towels, so remember to bring down your bath towels but then make sure you call for more. This is too confusing. The day we left (saturday) the pool was overun by the residents so be prepared to fight for the chairs. Health Club was extensive. The Mall/Arcade area that connects to the Marriott, has some shops and a mini-mart. In general it was a nice place to sleep and a nice home bace equadistant to the beach and shopping. Restaurants are either on the beach or in Coconut Grove area. This seems to be very much a buisness man/convention hotel also close to docks for cruise ship departure. Would proboly never stay here again but was a nice experience. Try the Marriott nextdoor it seemed more updated. If you want to stay on the Beach...Marriott South Beach and The Bentley Beach are great upscale places to stay. If you are on a budget stay at The Grand

Reviews.Title: “Blah!”
Reviews.Author: in_love_with_SoBe
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, if you do decide to stay at the Doubletree Grand Hotel Biscayne Bay, ask for a room NEAR THE ELEVATOR! Our room was towards the back of the hotel and took FOREVER to walk to (around several long corners and up a short flight of stairs). This was especially annoying when trying to cart around our luggage. Anyhow, I personally, would never have a desire to stay at this property again. It was in downtown Miami (near just about nothing) which, in my opinion, was incredibly boring and out of the way. Also, the service at the front desk was TERRIBLE! #1 I had booked 2 rooms, one of which a friend was to check into prior to my arrival. She gave my name at the front desk and was rudely told by the agent that they didn't have a record of the reservation and to wait in the lobby for me to arrive. When I did arrive, I gave my name to the agent (a different agent than the one she had dealt with) and had no issues. In other words, my friend had to wait for an hour sitting in the lobby for no good reason. #2 My best girlfriend called the front desk for an ammenity and was rudely told that they would not bring it to the room, but that she'd have to come down and get it herself. Which, being that our room was a quarter of a mile away from the elevator, she said forget it. #3 When we came back to our room in the evening, we found that our room key card was no longer working. I called from my friends room only to be rudely told once again that I'd have to come back to the front desk to receive a new one. I explained to the agent that our room was incredibly far from the elevator and would like for somebody to bring me a new key, as my feet were now blistered at this point from the quarter mile long walk from the elevator to our room. She maintained her position that in order to receive a new card we'd have to come to the front desk to pick one up. Um, HELLO! It's not my fault that the key stopped working! Work with me here! Grrrr... The pool has an amazing view and was huge, but very boring. They have a bar that isn't even open, so in order to get any sort of drink you have to bring it up from the lobby. Our room was, however, very nice and clean. An entire wall full of huge windows with a partial view of the water. Our bed was just fine and the room in general was very modern. I will post pictures as soon as I can.

HotelInfo.Name: Doubletree by Hilton Grand Hotel Biscayne Bay
HotelInfo.Address: 1717 North Bayshore Drive, Miami, FL 33132-1180
